column2: Director - Operations and Enterprise Monitoring   The Company is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Director - Operations and Enterprise Monitoring to join its Sri Lanka leadership team as the Head of Platform Services and Digital Infrastructure, to lead and manage its observability and event management initiatives.  The Director  Enterprise Monitoring will be responsible for overseeing the implementation, maintenance, and optimization of enterprise-wide monitoring systems, ensuring effective observability into the organizations IT infrastructure and applications.  The ideal candidate will focus on aligning monitoring practices with ITIL principles and driving efficient service delivery, in addition to leading a team of monitoring professionals, collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure the stability, performance, and availability of critical systems.    CORE RESPONSIBILITIES Developing and implementing a comprehensive monitoring and alerting, and event management strategy, in alignment with ITIL best practices and service delivery goals. Leading and managing a team of technical operations professionals, providing guidance, mentoring and performance evaluations. Overseeing the implementation and maintenance of enterprise monitoring and alerting tools and platforms to ensure the visibility and availability of enterprise systems.  Defining and enforcing monitoring policies, standards, and procedures, and ensuring adherence across the organization by conducting regular assessments and audits.  Providing overall technical delivery leadership to multiple teams and taking responsibility for driving the adoption of best-in-class delivery and technical operations practices.  Translating business strategy into actionable items and working with stakeholders to ensure key business outcomes are met.  Working with offshore and onshore business and technical teams to ensure strict quality standards are maintained and relevant projects are delivered as per quality, time and cost expectations.  Collaborating with cross-functional teams to identify key metrics, thresholds, and alerts to proactively identify and resolve issues.  Implementing effective ITSM practices, ensuring timely resolution of incidents and minimizing service disruptions.  Staying updated on industry trends and emerging technologies and providing recommendations for process/tools improvements; fostering a culture of continuous improvement, knowledge sharing and innovation within the monitoring team.   ANCILLARY RESPONSIBILITIES Leading and managing the Cloud Engineering and Support team, in partnership with onshore stakeholders, providing mentorship and guidance; developing and implementing a comprehensive cloud strategy and roadmap aligned with The Company' goals and industry best practices.  Championing DevOps practices, promoting automation, continuous integration, and continuous deployment in the cloud environment; driving operational excellence through monitoring, optimizing, and maintaining cloud services to provide high availability and performance.   Collaborating with cross-functional teams to integrate cloud services with existing systems and applications seamlessly.  Ensuring the availability, scalability, and performance of cloud-based platforms by implementing appropriate monitoring and alerting mechanisms; leading incident management and problem resolution processes for cloud-related incidents, ensuring swift and effective resolution.  Collaborating with the security team to ensure cloud infrastructure and operations comply with industry standards and best practices.   REQUIREMENTS A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field; a Master's Degree is a plus.  A minimum of 12 years experience in the IT industry with at least 6 years experience in a senior leadership role.  Proven experience (8+ years) in enterprise monitoring and event management and cloud services, with a focus on maintaining system availability and performance.  Experience in an agile environment; familiarity with other Project Management methodologies will be an added advantage.  In-depth knowledge of ITIL principles and their application in monitoring and service delivery. Experience in implementing and managing monitoring tools/platforms. Proficiency in establishing and managing enterprise monitoring standards, policies, and processes.  Experience working with Data Dog, Service Now or other monitoring and ITSM platforms.  An understanding of cloud-based infrastructure, microservices architecture, and distributed systems is preferred.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve complex technical issues.  Relevant certifications in ITIL or event management would be an advantage.  Demonstrated ability to drive continuous improvement and adhere to industry best practices. Excellent leadership and people management skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams.  Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.    BENEFITS ??US dollar-linked compensation ??Performance-based annual bonus ??Performance rewards and recognition ??Agile Benefits - special allowances for Health, Wellness & Academic purposes ??Entertainment allowance ??Team engagement allowance ??Comprehensive Health & Life Insurance Cover - extendable to parents and in-laws ??Overseas travel opportunities and exposure to client environments ??Hybrid work arrangement    THE BIG PICTURE   The Sri Lankan Entity is a captive innovation center for the Parent Company; a Fortune 100 company and the worlds largest foodservice provider with over 725,000 customers in 90 countries.  For fiscal 2023 that ended July 1, 2023, the Company generated over $76 billion in sales.  The Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer Apply in Confidence or request a call for further information.

column2: An IT Infrastructure Engineer is a professional who specializes in designing, implementing, and maintaining the IT infrastructure of an organization     They are responsible for ensuring the availability, performance, and security of the organization's hardware, software, networks, and related systems         Here are the key responsibilities and qualifications associated with the role of an IT Infrastructure Engineer         Design and Implementation: Design, plan, and implement IT infrastructure solutions that meet the organization's requirements     This includes servers, networks, storage systems, virtualization, operating systems, and other hardware and software components     System Administration: Administer and maintain servers, operating systems, and related infrastructure components     Install, configure, and troubleshoot server hardware, operating systems, and applications     Monitor system performance and implement optimizations to ensure optimal operation     Network Management: Configure, monitor, and troubleshoot network devices such as routers, switches, firewalls, and load balancers     Implement and maintain network security measures, including firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and virtual private networks (VPNs)     Data Storage and Backup: Manage data storage systems, including storage area networks (SANs), network-attached storage (NAS), and cloud storage solutions     Implement data backup and disaster recovery strategies to ensure the integrity and availability of critical data     Security and Compliance: Implement and maintain security measures to protect the organization's IT infrastructure     This includes managing user access controls, implementing security patches and updates, monitoring for security breaches, and ensuring compliance with industry regulations and best practices     Virtualization and Cloud Computing: Deploy and manage virtualization technologies such as VMware or Hyper-V to optimize server resources and improve scalability     Implement and manage cloud computing solutions, such as Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) or Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS), for increased flexibility and cost efficiency     IT Infrastructure Monitoring: Deploy and utilize monitoring tools to proactively monitor the performance, availability, and capacity of IT infrastructure components     Monitor system logs, alerts, and performance metrics to identify and resolve issues promptly     Incident Response and Troubleshooting: Respond to and resolve IT infrastructure-related incidents, including performance issues, outages, and security breaches     Troubleshoot and diagnose hardware, software, and network problems to minimize downtime and ensure smooth operation     Change Management: Implement change management processes to ensure that changes to the IT infrastructure are properly planned, tested, documented, and implemented with minimal disruption to the organization's operations     Documentation and Knowledge Sharing: Maintain accurate documentation of the IT infrastructure, including network diagrams, system configurations, and standard operating procedures     Share knowledge and provide training to IT staff and end-users on infrastructure-related topics     Qualifications:Education: A bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field is typically required     Relevant certifications, such as Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA), Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE), or VMware Certified Professional (VCP), are highly valued     Technical Skills: Proficiency in server administration, network management, operating systems (Windows, Linux, etc), virtualization technologies, storage systems, and cloud computing platforms     Familiarity with IT security principles and best practices     Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Strong troubleshooting skills to identify and resolve complex infrastructure issues     Ability to analyze data and performance metrics to optimize infrastructure performance and capacity     Communication and Collaboration: Effective communication skills to interact with stakeholders, IT teams, and vendors     Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement and support IT infrastructure solutions     Project Management: Experience in managing IT infrastructure projects, including planning, resource allocation, and project delivery within defined timelines
column11: VMware, Linux, Project management, Network security, Windows, CCNA, MCSE, Information technology, Virtualization, System administration

column2: As a Senior IT Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and managing the day-to-day IT operations within the organization     You will lead a team of professionals and work closely with other departments to ensure the smooth functioning of IT systems, infrastructure, and services     This role requires a combination of technical expertise, leadership skills, and strategic thinking to drive operational efficiency and support business objectives                                                 Responsibilities         IT Operations Management: Manage and maintain the organizations IT systems and services, ensuring their availability, reliability, and security. Manage technology and business operations for the enterprise IT landscape     Drive Operations Excellence: Oversee the resolution of IT incidents and problems, ensuring timely response, troubleshooting, and escalation as needed. Establish and enforce IT service management processes to minimize disruptions and downtime. Drive initiatives to improve availability, latency, scalability and efficiency of the enterprise IT landscape. Coordinate and manage outside vendors, contract negotiations and service level agreements.     Team Leadership: Lead and mentor a team of system administrators, SRE/DevOps Engineers and business support engineers. Set performance goals, develop career paths, provide guidance, conduct performance evaluations, and foster a collaborative and productive work environment.     Stakeholder Collaboration: Develop and deliver on the long-term vision on engagement and governance with the stakeholders.     Strategic Planning: Develop and execute IT strategies and roadmap aligned with business goals. Identify areas for improvement, propose solutions, and implement technology initiatives to enhance operational efficiency, scalability, and security. Drive execution of the roadmaps with relentless focus on results, impact and ROI     Continuous Improvement: Monitor industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies to identify opportunities for operational improvements and innovation. Drive process enhancements, automation initiatives, and adoption of new technologies to optimize IT operations and enhance user experience. Be an active thought leader both internally and externally to internalize trends to drive vision and awareness.            Minimum Qualifications         Bachelors degree with minimum of 15+ years of experience in software industry     Proven experience in IT operations, DevOps, or a similar role, with increasing levels of responsibility.     Expertise in areas such as administration of ERP/CRM systems, cloud computing, security, and IT service management.     Proficiency in ITIL (Information Technology Infrastructure Library) processes and frameworks.     Experience in leading and managing a team, including performance management, coaching, and career development.     Excellent problem-solving and decision-making skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously.     Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.     Knowledge of industry regulations and compliance requirements.     Familiarity with project management methodologies and tools.     Proven ability to collaborate with virtual team members and stakeholders     Coaching and listening skills     Ability to exercise sound judgement and resolve complex issues

column2: R1 RCM India is proud to be recognized amongst India's Top 50 Best Companies to Work For 2023 by Great Place To Work? Institute. We are committed to transform the healthcare industry with our innovative revenue cycle management services. Our goal is to ??ake healthcare simpler??and enable efficiency for healthcare systems, hospitals, and physician practices. With over 30,000 employees globally, we are about 14,000 strong in India with offices in Delhi NCR, Hyderabad, Bangalore, and Chennai. Our inclusive culture ensures that every employee feels valued, respected, and appreciated with a robust set of employee benefits and engagement activities About the role:    Set your sights on a role making a real difference in the healthcare system. We??e looking for a self-motivated Service Transition Coordinator professional to join our team. The Service Transition position will involve Change and Release Management responsibilities.  We have a relentless focus on driving results for our customers and enabling them to invest more into patient care; in turn, this allows us to continue to grow our company and your career.   This person will have the ability to understand and implement ITSM Service Transition strategies for Change and Release Management.  Service Transition Coordinator should look for ways to streamline and improve the Service Transition processes and SDLC interrelated processes.   This position will take part in other ITSM processes, or as required perform as a back up to maintain operational activities within the Service Transition team.  General Skill Set:   Technical Graduate (B.Tech/BE/MCA/BCA/MSc/BSc-Computer Science) or equivalent academic qualification.  2-4 years of previous Change & Release Management (ITIL) experience  2-4 years of experience in information systems operations environment in systems analysis or development  Knowledge of software development lifecycle (SDLC)  Written and verbal communication skills are a must  General PC knowledge including Microsoft Office (Excel and Word),  Demonstrated effective experience in working with Agile and Scrum teams  Demonstrated effective oral and written communication skills  Demonstrated ability to coordinate cross-functional work teams toward task completion  Demonstrated effective analytical skills  Demonstrated active listening skills  Energetic and proactive with a "can-do" attitude  Flexible and adaptable; able to work in ambiguous situations  Must be a team player and able to work collaboratively with and through others  Experience of ITSM tool sets preferably Service Now  Certification in ITIL Foundations v4  Experience with Project Management practices  Your day to day activity will include for Change & Release Management coordinator:   Change:   Effectively manage the end to end change lifecycle and identify process improvements where possible.  Conduct impact analyses, assess change readiness and identify key stakeholders  Day to day management of change requests  Identification and allocation of relevant change approvals  Support change management at the organizational level  Support the design, development, delivery and management of communications  Conducting & verifying post implementation reviews, investigating issues arising out of change implementation  Responsible to review Change Schedule (CS) for conflicts  Responsible for education of the Change Management process  Drive continuous improvements to the quality and efficiency of the change management process  Responsible for drafting of business wide communications for outages  Involved in the implementation of the Asset Management process and recording of modifications in relationship to changes  Report Change Management activities to all levels of management.  Release:  Communicate all key project plans, commitments, and changes including requirements, QA plans, schedule, and scope changes  Manage relationships and coordinate work between different teams at different locations  Conduct Release Readiness reviews, Milestone Reviews, and Business Go/No-Go reviews  Produce and/or review Deployment and Implementation Plans  Weekly Release Reporting  Communicate release details and schedules to the Business as required  Negotiate, plan and manage all release activities  Work with release engineers to understand impacts of branches and code merges  Maintains the release schedule for all core services and ensure alignment across key partners and vendors.  Continually work towards making improvements in the release process  Lead and co-ordinate the Go-Live activities including the execution of the deployment Plans and checklists.  Participate in Change meetings to discuss release scope and/or roadblocks  Maintains a release repository and manages key information such as build and release procedures, dependencies, and notification lists

column2: Job Description Position Overview: As an Aruba Controller Expert (Network Engineer L3) with a focus on Cisco, Candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining Aruba wireless network infrastructure integrated with Cisco technologies. He / She will work closely with cross-functional teams and clients to provide technical expertise, troubleshooting assistance, and ensure the optimal performance of Aruba wireless networks integrated with Cisco networking solutions. This role requires deep knowledge and experience in both Aruba wireless controllers and Cisco networking technologies.   Design and Implementation   Collaborate with clients and stakeholders to gather requirements and design Aruba wireless network solutions integrated with Cisco infrastructure Configure, deploy, and manage Aruba wireless controllers and Cisco network devices, including switches, routers, and access points (APs) Design and implement VLANs, inter-VLAN routing, and security policies across Aruba and Cisco networking devices. Ensure network designs adhere to industry best practices, security standards, and scalability requirements   Network Troubleshooting and Support   Perform advanced troubleshooting to identify and resolve complex network issues related to Aruba controllers, Cisco devices, and their integration. Monitor network performance, identify bottlenecks, and implement corrective measures to optimize performance Collaborate with Level 1 and Level 2 support teams to provide expert assistance and guidance in resolving escalated issues. Act as a subject matter expert (SME) for Aruba controller and Cisco-related queries, both internally and externally.   Network Security   Implement and enforce security policies and configurations to protect Aruba wireless networks integrated with Cisco infrastructure Configure and manage Cisco security features, such as Access, Control Lists (ACLs), Virtual Private Networks (VPNs), and Firewalls. Conduct security audits, vulnerability assessments, and penetration testing to identify and mitigate potential risks. Stay up-to-date with the latest security threats and industry trends to proactively address vulnerabilities. Documentation and Reporting   Maintain accurate documentation, including network diagrams, configurations, and troubleshooting procedures for both Aruba and Cisco devices Create detailed reports on network performance, incidents, and recommendations for improvements Participate in knowledge sharing activities, trainings, and mentorship programs to enhance the technical skills of junior team members Collaboration and Project Management   Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including network architects, system administrators, and security analysts, to ensure seamless integration of Aruba wireless networks with Cisco infrastructure Participate in project planning, execution, and delivery, ensuring adherence to timelines and project requirements Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior engineers in the team

column2: Job Title: IT Manager  Location: Gurugram  Company: Antara Senior Living  Job Description: We are seeking a skilled and experienced IT Manager to oversee all aspects of information technology operations within our Antara Senior Living. The IT Manager will be responsible for ensuring the smooth functioning of all IT systems and infrastructure to support the business objectives. This role requires a combination of technical expertise, leadership skills, and a customer-focused approach to service delivery.  Key Responsibilities:  1. System Administration: Manage and maintain all IT systems, including servers, networks, databases, and applications. Ensure high availability, reliability, and security of systems.  2. Infrastructure & Project Management: Oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of IT infrastructure, including hardware, software, and networking equipment.  3. User Support: Provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance to hotel staff for IT related issues. Ensure prompt resolution of problems to minimize downtime and disruption to operations.  4. Vendor Management: Collaborate with third-party vendors and service providers to procure IT products and services. Evaluate vendor proposals, negotiate contracts, and monitor vendor performance.  5. Security Compliance: Implement and enforce security policies, procedures, and controls to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information assets. Conduct regular security audits and risk assessments.  6. Data Management: Manage the storage, backup, and recovery of critical data. Develop data management policies and procedures to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and confidentiality.  7. IT Strategy: Develop and implement an IT strategy aligned with the business goals. Identify opportunities for leveraging technology to improve operational efficiency and guest experience. 8. Team Leadership: Lead and mentor a team of IT professionals. Provide guidance, training, and performance feedback to ensure the team's effectiveness and professional development.  9. Budget Management: Develop and manage the IT budget, including capital expenditures and operating expenses. Ensure cost-effective use of resources while maintaining high-quality IT services.  10. Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate documentation of IT systems, configurations, and procedures. Prepare regular reports on IT performance, projects, and initiatives for management review.  Qualifications: - Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field. Master's degree  preferred. - Minimum of 8 years of experience in IT management & projects, preferably in the hospitality or  healthcare industry. - Proven experience with IT systems and infrastructure, including servers, networks, databases, and  applications. - Strong knowledge of security best practices and compliance requirements. - Excellent leadership and team management skills. - Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. - Ability to work effectively under pressure and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment. - Relevant certifications (e.g., CISSP, CCNA, PMP) are a plus. This is a challenging and rewarding opportunity for an experienced IT professional to make a  significant impact on the technology operations. If you have the required skills and qualifications,  we invite you to apply for the position of IT Manager

column2: We are seeking an experienced Enterprise Compute and Storage Architect/Project Manager to lead and oversee on-premises infrastructure initiatives within our organization. This pivotal role involves designing, implementing, and managing scalable compute and storage solutions to support our enterprise-level operations. The ideal candidate will possess a strong blend of technical expertise in compute and storage technologies, coupled with exceptional project management skills to drive successful project delivery within predefined timelines and budgets. Youll collaborate closely with a team of professionals and third-party vendors to achieve your goals. This role offers an exciting opportunity to shape the future of our IT infrastructure landscape while ensuring optimal performance, reliability, and security.     Additionally, this multifaceted role requires profound leadership expertise and the ability to provide guidance across various compute, storage and network technologies, including x86, GPU, virtualization, NFS, SAN, FC and LAN.       Working experience           Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field; Masters degree preferred.     Proven experience as a Compute and Storage Architect/Project Manager, with a minimum of 10 years in enterprise IT infrastructure roles.     Expertise in designing and implementing compute and storage solutions utilizing technologies such as virtualization, server hardware, storage area networks (SAN), network-attached storage (NAS).     Strong project management skills with a demonstrated ability to lead complex IT infrastructure projects from initiation to completion, adhering to deadlines and budgets.     Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail and a proactive approach to identifying and resolving technical challenges.     Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, influence stakeholders, and present complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.     Industry certifications such as VMware Certified Professional (VCP), Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA), or Project Management Professional (PMP) are highly desirable.     Implementation of compute processes, with proven experience in complex process management.     IT Enterprise Compute risk Management, Compute governance.     Attended meetings with IT Enterprise compute and storage teams, to identify opportunities to enhance measures.     Third Party Management     Support of IT audits     Knowledge of IT infrastructure, compute architecture concepts and principles     Presentation skills with PowerPoint, Office365     Hands-on experience in managing multi country and intercultural teams (internal and external).             Skills         Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills.     Strong problem and analytical skills, the ability to manage complex projects under strict timelines, as well as the ability to work well in a demanding, dynamic environment and meet overall objectives.     Proven architectural and project management skills.     Proven people co-ordination skills.     Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.     Adaptability and a willingness to embrace new technologies and industry best practices.     Making it work mentality     English fluent             Other Skills - nice to have         Data analysis and visualization with Power BI, Excel, Power Point, etc.. Office365.             Knowledge and awareness         IT Enterprise Compute x86 hardware, virtualization.     IT Enterprise Compute storage hardware (NFS, NAS, FC and backup)     IT Enterprise Network (Access and Distribution)         Key Interfaces         S&T Operations     S&T Bell Labs      S&T NOKIA Standards     S&T Group Security         Main Responsibility Areas         Architectural Design:      Develop comprehensive compute and storage architectures tailored to meet the organizations evolving needs, considering factors such as scalability, performance, reliability, and cost-effectiveness. Co-operate with other architects inside and outside the team on Enterprise Compute, Hardware Engineering Platform, Domain and E2E Architecture @ECCS level.         Technology Evaluation:      Stay abreast of emerging compute and storage technologies, conduct thorough evaluations, and make informed recommendations for adoption based on business requirements and industry best practices.         Project Management:      Lead end-to-end project lifecycle from initiation to closure, including project planning, resource allocation, risk management, and stakeholder communication, ensuring alignment with business objectives.         Vendor Management:      Collaborate and supported by Nokia s procurement team with vendors to procure hardware, software, and services, negotiate contracts, and manage vendor relationships to ensure timely delivery and quality of products and services.         Implementation and Deployment:      Oversee the implementation of compute and storage solutions, working closely with cross-functional teams in Compute & Storage to ensure successful deployment while adhering to established timelines and quality standards.         Performance Optimization:      Continuously monitor and optimize compute and storage infrastructure performance, identifying areas for improvement and implementing solutions to enhance efficiency, reliability, and scalability.         Security and Compliance:      Implement robust security measures and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, industry standards, and organizational policies to safeguard data integrity and confidentiality.         Documentation and Reporting:      Maintain comprehensive documentation of compute and storage configurations, processes, and procedures, and generate regular reports to track project status, performance metrics, and key milestones.         Cooperation with Licensing Teams:      Licensing Compliance: Collaborate with licensing teams to ensure compliance with software and hardware licensing agreements.     Optimization: Identify opportunities to optimize licensing costs while maintaining compliance.         Collaboration and Communication:      Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including leadership, to ensure seamless system operation.     Effectively communicate with internal stakeholders and external vendors.

Monitor the performance of the network and applications,      implementing improvements wherever necessary. Ensure network security best practices are implemented and followed. Document and manage configuration, development, and troubleshooting      procedures. Participate in the creation of a disaster recovery plan and business      continuity strategies. column2: ProArch is an IT services and consulting company headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia with offices in Rochester, New York, London, Hyderabad and Bangalore, India. Our business is growing, and to serve our customers in the best possible manner, ProArch is looking to hire highly qualified, motivated, hard-working professionals.      The Manager of Cloud and Infrastructure Support Engineering is expected to oversee the day-to-day operations of ProArch India s support engineering group. Also, this role is accountable to the success and delivery of Managed Support Services to ProArch s customers.      As a member of the Cloud and Infrastructure Department, the Manager of Engineering reports directly to the Managing Director of Cloud and Infrastructure. The Manager of Engineering will work closely with their US counterparts to ensure processes and delivery remain consistent across the department.      To be successful, you will draw upon your considerable past achievements in owning and refining Support and Success playbooks and processes for scale, including the escalation process to Level 2 and Level 3 Engineering, measuring SLAs, and continuous improvements and team utilization. It is through your dedication to continuous improvement of how TSEs operate - both in efficiency and effectiveness - that will help us meet and surpass customer cases, satisfaction, and growth targets.              Primary Responsibilities             Creation of Engineering team, implementation of processes, development of resources and ongoing management of an MSP IT support team in India. This team will support India client as well as US support clients, as requested.      Accountable for the work of the Engineer group and ensure that team resources are aligning to the goals of the organization.      Drive and maintain acceptable billable and client utilization rates for team resources.      Work with the team to provide first-line support response to customers as well as additional proactive services in accordance with client services contracts.      Understand, troubleshoot, analyze and resolve technical issues reported by the customer with a level of urgency, communication clarity, and transparency that turns escalations into positive experiences.      Serving as an escalation point for customers and critical customer issues; serving as a liaison to other internal departments and stakeholders.      Create and track support requests in the case management system/ITSM tool.      Prioritize tasks and accurately document the nature of the reported problem.          Responsible for the development of team resource skills and abilities related to the strategic products and services provided by ProArch.      Responsible for quarterly team goal setting and resource performance reviews      Conduct regular 1x1 meetings with team resources to strengthen manager resource relations and to serve as a mentor and advisor on work challenges.      Conduct monthly team meetings to align team resources to best practices, procedures, and standards and to further the initiatives of ProArch and the Cloud and Infrastructure Team.      Accountable for the successful delivery of Managed Support Services to ProArch customers and striving to maintain a high-level of client satisfaction.      Team Leadership: Lead and manage a team of engineers, providing guidance, mentorship, and support to drive high performance and professional growth.      Technical Project Management: Oversee the planning, execution, and delivery of engineering projects, ensuring they are completed within schedule, budget, and quality parameters.      Quality Assurance: Implement and enforce quality assurance processes and best practices to ensure the delivery of reliable and robust software solutions.      Process Improvement: Continuously evaluate and improve engineering processes, tools, and methodologies to enhance team productivity and software development efficiency.      Collaboration: Foster a collaborative and cross-functional working environment, promoting effective communication and coordination among teams to achieve project goals.      Technical Expertise: Stay updated with emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices in software engineering and IT infrastructure management to drive innovation and maintain a competitive edge.      Performance Monitoring: Establish performance metrics, monitor team and individual performance, and provide regular feedback and performance evaluations.      Risk Management: Identify and mitigate technical risks, proactively addressing potential issues that may impact project timelines or deliverables.      Accountable for the achievement of Service Level Agreements (SLA) and Issue Escalation goals.      Responsible for resolving client dissatisfaction and direct communication follow-up with clients.      Participates and contributes to Cloud Infrastructure initiative and overall ProArch delivery initiatives and goal setting.      Consulted on Managed Support Services program changes.      Responsible for new hire onboarding and orientation.      Responsible for the accurate and timely review and approval of weekly timesheets, PTO requests, and expense reports for direct team reports.      At the direction of the Managing Director of Cloud and Infrastructure, carry out the strategic and tactical goals of the ProArch executive leadership team.          Participates with other resources in Level 3 On-Call Management Escalation on reoccurring interval.      Responsible for analyzing team workloads and distributing appropriately.      Responsible for recruitment and retention of team resources including annual salary budgeting, hiring, career development and performance improvement plans.      Accountable for accurate and up-to-date client documentation.      Accountable for successful client onboarding and offboarding to Managed Support Service.      Sets appropriate expectations for Service Desk delivery goals.      Consulted on the progress of the Service Desk Team.      Reviews the performance of the Service Desk Team and provides guidance on improvement.      Responsible for the completion of all activities within the agreed time and of quality and ensure metrics are met as per agreed KPIs / SLAs targets as applicable.      Occasionally sits in on Service Desk client calls to ensure quality assurance.      Collaborates with other delivery teams to ensure alignment to organizational goals and initiatives.      Ensure to route tickets in the ITSM tool to the respective support team queue timely.      Author, contribute, and drive Knowledge Base Articles and User Guides.      Provides feedback to line managers regarding the performance of resources outside of their direct team.              Education and Certification Requirements:        Minimum of a bachelors degree in IT or Computer Science, MS/MSC/M. TECH/MBA (Preferred)      7+ years experience in the field of Information Technology relating to IT support

column2: IT Manager/Assistant IT Manager        (      Job Number:          HOT0AFQG    )          Work Locations      :          Hilton Garden Inn Trivandrum            Muthoot Centre - Level 2        Punnen Road            Trivandrum        695034                    With thousands of hotels in over 100 countries and territories,  Hilton offers countless opportunities to delight.  From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience,  we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget.  In addition to our flagship brand,  Hilton Hotels & Resorts,  the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria,  LXR,  Conrad,  Canopy,  Curio Collection,  DoubleTree,  Hilton Garden Inn,  Hampton and many others.      If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world,  you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member.  Because it s with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests,  Team Members,  and owners alike.          The IT Manager s core responsibilty is to ensure the smooth and efficient operation of the IT Department.   This role is also responsible for hotel purchasing duties,  procuring items required by management at competitive prices without compromising quality.            What will I be doing?       As the IT Manager,  you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:       IT        Maximize and protect hotel profitability through the leverage of Information Technology,  training and operational best practices.      Maximize opportunities to reduce IT costs through effective purchasing and negotiating maintenance contracts.      Identify and propose opportunities to optimize revenue.      Responsible for timely preparation and submission of all IT budgets.      Responsible for the management and control of all IT expense according to an agreed plan.      Ensure a business continuity plan is established and tested for all parts of the business.      Provide the highest possible IT service to the agreed standards and best practices.      Work with Business Management to expedite access and better utilization of information.      Implement and exploit telephony services to HI minimum defined standards.      Ensure guests  IT queries are managed to defined standards with minimal risks.      Ensure brand standards are communicated and maintained for Guest and Business Service.      Ensure the hotel adopts and maintains brand standards for guests and business services in relation to IT services and offerings.      Consistently promote the brand and encourage the use of the brand by IT suppliers.      Ensure IT resources are maintained in the hotel to support the commercial & business needs.      Identify and ensure all hotel data has ownership and accountability within the organization.      Ensure a successor is identified and trained to the standard.      Provide IT support to other Hilton hotels when required.      Cross train other hotel IT personnel to provide cover.      Maintain standards and best practices in the hotel and evaluate compliance     Manage and monitor local vendors and / or local representatives of global / area vendors.      Ensure that hotel data is secured and in line with stated standards and best practices.      Ensure Access Control is in line with stated standards and best practices.      Ensure regular self-evaluations of IT practices are completed and communicated.      Manage local implementation projects.      Communicate status,  risks,  opportunities to GM,  hotel management and regional and area IT management.      Adhere to the hotel s security and emergency policies and procedures.      Ensure that all team members have a complete understanding of and adhere to the hotel s team member rules and regulations.      The Management reserves the right to change / extend this job description if necessary,  at any point of time during her / his employment.      Carry out any other reasonable duties and responsibilities as assigned.          Purchasing        Follow hotel purchasing policy and procedures when carrying out of all purchases.      Obtain three competitive quotes from suppliers to minimize cost to hotel.      Conduct interviews with suppliers,  representatives and obtain information,  specification,  quotations on any items required,  handling subsequent correspondence and negotiations for procurement.      Place orders with suppliers to ensure timely delivery to satisfy hotel requirement and trace the outstanding orders to ensure operational needs are met.      Check pricing of purchase orders and determine appropriate suppliers to obtain best quality and price.      Conduct market surveys to understand market trends and the price floating.      Safeguard the petty cash float (if any) so as to ensure no unauthorized access to the float,  ensuring that it is kept in the safe.      Collect the Market List quotation at regular intervals.      Regularly review contract supplies to ensure prices are still competitive.      Maintain competitor knowledge of similar products by regularly surveying price lists of other hotels  operation supplies.      Analyze market trends to anticipate likely price fluctuations,  for the purpose of maintaining inventory either for long or short time periods.      Ensure all documentation (purchase orders,  invoices,  delivery dockets etc. ) is forwarded to Accounts Payable on a timely basis.      Flexible in relation to work hours.      Minimize the risk of accidents and workers  compensation costs by ensuring the correct work practices are used and that the area is safe from hazards.      Handle all requests and enquiries in a timely,  efficient and friendly manner.      Strictly follow the code of conduct.      The Management reserves the right to change / extend this job description if necessary,  at any point of time during her / his employment.      Carry out any other reasonable duties and responsibilities as assigned.                          What are we looking for?       An IT Manager serving Hilton Brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members.  To successfully fill this role,  you should maintain the attitude,  behaviours,  skills,  and values that follow:       Five to seven years of relevant IT management experience.      At least 1 year of working experience as Purchaser or higher in the hospitality industry.      Sound technical understanding of the management of IT in a service organization.      Good personality to deal with guests.      Capable of training team members.      Possess strong project management and presentation skills.      IT qualification / training.      Fluency in both spoken and written English,  to meet business needs,  is desirable.      Knowledge of supplies management.      Experience in similar capacity with international chain hotels.      Working experience within Hilton Group is advantageous.              What will it be like to work for Hilton?       Hilton is the leading global hospitality company,  spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels.  For nearly a century,  Hilton has offered business and leisure travellers the finest in accommodations,  service,  amenities and value.  Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands.  Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day.  And,  our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!                     Job      :        Finance          Schedule      :        Full-time

You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, project management, and customer support, to ensure successful adoption and implementation of Google Workspace solutions. Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.   Google Workspace certification is a plus.

column2: An IT Infrastructure Engineer is a professional who specializes in designing, implementing, and maintaining the IT infrastructure of an organization     They are responsible for ensuring the availability, performance, and security of the organization's hardware, software, networks, and related systems     Here are the key responsibilities and qualifications associated with the role of an IT Infrastructure Engineer:     Responsibilities:     Design and Implementation: Design, plan, and implement IT infrastructure solutions that meet the organization's requirements     This includes servers, networks, storage systems, virtualization, operating systems, and other hardware and software components     System Administration: Administer and maintain servers, operating systems, and related infrastructure components     Install, configure, and troubleshoot server hardware, operating systems, and applications     Monitor system performance and implement optimizations to ensure optimal operation     Network Management: Configure, monitor, and troubleshoot network devices such as routers, switches, firewalls, and load balancers     Implement and maintain network security measures, including firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and virtual private networks (VPNs)     Data Storage and Backup: Manage data storage systems, including storage area networks (SANs), network-attached storage (NAS), and cloud storage solutions     Implement data backup and disaster recovery strategies to ensure the integrity and availability of critical data     Security and Compliance: Implement and maintain security measures to protect the organization's IT infrastructure     This includes managing user access controls, implementing security patches and updates, monitoring for security breaches, and ensuring compliance with industry regulations and best practices     Virtualization and Cloud Computing: Deploy and manage virtualization technologies such as VMware or Hyper-V to optimize server resources and improve scalability     Implement and manage cloud computing solutions, such as Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) or Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS), for increased flexibility and cost efficiency     IT Infrastructure Monitoring: Deploy and utilize monitoring tools to proactively monitor the performance, availability, and capacity of IT infrastructure components     Monitor system logs, alerts, and performance metrics to identify and resolve issues promptly     Incident Response and Troubleshooting: Respond to and resolve IT infrastructure-related incidents, including performance issues, outages, and security breaches     Troubleshoot and diagnose hardware, software, and network problems to minimize downtime and ensure smooth operation     Change Management: Implement change management processes to ensure that changes to the IT infrastructure are properly planned, tested, documented, and implemented with minimal disruption to the organization's operations     Documentation and Knowledge Sharing: Maintain accurate documentation of the IT infrastructure, including network diagrams, system configurations, and standard operating procedures     Share knowledge and provide training to IT staff and end-users on infrastructure-related topics     Qualifications:Education: A bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field is typically required     Relevant certifications, such as Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA), Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE), or VMware Certified Professional (VCP), are highly valued     Technical Skills: Proficiency in server administration, network management, operating systems (Windows, Linux, etc     ), virtualization technologies, storage systems, and cloud computing platforms     Familiarity with IT security principles and best practices     Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Strong troubleshooting skills to identify and resolve complex infrastructure issues     Ability to analyze data and performance metrics to optimize infrastructure performance and capacity     Communication and Collaboration: Effective communication skills to interact with stakeholders, IT teams, and vendors     Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement and support IT infrastructure solutions     Project Management: Experience in managing IT infrastructure projects, including planning, resource allocation, and project delivery within defined timelines       ?
column11: IT infrastructure

column1: Assistant Vice President /Vice President  - IT Infrastructure
column2: Position: Assistant Vice President (AVP) - IT Infrastructure Job Description: As an Assistant Vice President (AVP) specializing in IT infrastructure, you will play a pivotal role in overseeing the setup and management of call centers, with a particular emphasis on experience in government tenders, bid management, RFQs, and RFIs. Additionally, you will be responsible for setting up data centers and servers, ensuring robust infrastructure to support organizational needs. Key Responsibilities: Call Center Setup and Management : Lead the end-to-end setup of call centers, ensuring the implementation of cutting-edge technology and infrastructure to support seamless operations. Oversee the ongoing management of call center systems and processes to optimize performance and enhance customer experience. Data Center and Server Setup : Design and implement data center infrastructure, including servers, storage, networking, and security systems. Ensure the availability, scalability, and reliability of data center services to support business operations. Government Tender Expertise : Utilize your expertise in government tenders to identify and pursue opportunities for call center projects within the public sector. Coordinate the tendering process, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and optimizing bid strategies to secure contracts. Bid Management : Lead the development and submission of bids for call center projects, leveraging your proficiency in bid management practices. Collaborate with internal teams to prepare comprehensive proposals that address client requirements and differentiate our offerings in the market. RFQs and RFIs Handling : Manage the response process for Requests for Quotation (RFQs) and Requests for Information (RFIs) related to call center infrastructure projects. Coordinate with relevant stakeholders to gather required information, prepare compelling responses, and meet submission deadlines. Strategic Planning and Execution : Develop strategic plans for IT infrastructure initiatives aligned with organizational objectives and market trends. Execute plans effectively, monitoring progress and making adjustments as necessary to ensure successful project delivery. Stakeholder Engagement : Cultivate and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including government agencies, clients, vendors, and internal teams. Collaborate closely with stakeholders to understand their requirements, address concerns, and drive alignment towards project goals. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. Advanced degree preferred. Proven experience in setting up and managing call centers, with a focus on government projects. Demonstrated expertise in handling government tenders, bid management, RFQs, and RFIs. Strong understanding of IT infrastructure technologies, including networking, telephony, servers, and cloud services. Experience in designing and implementing data center infrastructure, including servers, storage, and networking equipment. Excellent leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate teams towards achieving goals. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport with diverse stakeholders. Strategic thinker with a track record of developing and executing successful IT infrastructure initiatives. Familiarity with regulatory requirements and compliance standards relevant to call center operations. Project management certification (e.g., PMP) is a plus. This position offers an exciting opportunity to lead impactful projects at the intersection of IT infrastructure, call center operations, and data center management, contributing to organizational growth and success. If you thrive in a dynamic environment and are passionate about leveraging technology to drive business outcomes, we invite you to apply IF INTERESTED, EMAIL US YOUR CV on Bhargesh.jani@zhl.in or message on 9082267782

column2: We are looking for Senior Business analyst with 5 yrs to 10 yrs experience    Role Description- As a Business Analyst, you will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between our business needs and IT systems, ensuring successful delivery of technology solutions. You will work closely with stakeholders, project managers, and development teams to gather requirements, Analyze processes, and recommend effective solutions to enhance our business operations. The ideal candidate should possess a strong understanding of both business and technology, excellent analytical skills, and the ability to communicate effectively across different teams.    Key Responsibilities-  - Collaborate with stakeholders to understand and document business needs, goals, and requirements.   - Conduct thorough analysis of existing business processes, workflows, and systems to identify areas for improvement and optimization.   - Translate business requirements into clear and concise functional specifications for IT development teams.   - Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation, including business requirements, use cases, user stories, process flows, and system diagrams.   - Work closely with project managers and development teams to ensure accurate and timely delivery of technology solutions.   - Participate in system testing, quality assurance, and user acceptance testing to ensure solutions meet business requirements.   - Provide support and guidance to end-users during system implementations, including user training and documentation.   - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for process improvement and automation. Each level is labelled with a guiding phrase for the level of proficiency expected.  Level 1 - Follow   Level 2 - Assist   Level 3 - Apply Leve 4 - Enable   Level 5 - Ensure, advise   Level 6 -Initiate, influence  Level 7 - Set strategy, inspire, mobilise     Support Software Development Create      user stories and detailed technical scenarios including acceptance      criteria that support software development requests Work      with product owners to create user story goals and align team around      product vision Define      scope of initial product release, ensuring definition of Most Viable      Product (MVP) is clearly documented and aligned Assess      impact of requirements changes, creating a balanced approach (tradeoff      between value vs. time) to decision making Support Product Development Drive      feature and story grooming to identify high value items and prioritize      them in the backlog accordingly within team sprint planning session Analyse      application and business domain data requirements to understand data flow      from screen to screen Perform      validation testing of development deliverables to ensure that solutions      address business needs and meet acceptance criteria outlined Maintain      documentation of user stories and technical specifications within      development tool Creates      Business Requirements Specifications documents, which is then presented to      both product owners and developers System Requests Handles      different types of System Requests: Incidents and Change Requests, as well      as Queries and Downloads, and Data Clean-up Requests Performs      System, System Integration and Regression Tests with QA team Coordinate      with teams handling other systems as part of System Integration Testing Responsible      for UAT turnover, monitoring UAT phase and documentation sign-off as well      as post-implementation support   We have an exciting opening with Singapore Based client , candidates with Previous shipping & Logistics experience will be more preferable

column2: Role   Infra Automation Consultant Technology   Terraform   Job Description Today, the corporate landscape is dynamic and the world ahead is full of possibilities! None of the amazing things we do at Infosys would be possible without an equally amazing culture, the environment where ideas can flourish and where you are empowered to move forward as far as your ideas will take you. Our journey of learnability, values and trusted relationships with our clients continue to be the cornerstones of our organization and these values are upheld only because of our people.   Your role As an Infra Automation Consultant you will work on Infrastructure Automation in Terraform platform   Required At least 5+ years of programming experience in Terraform Good Communication skills Good analytical and problem-solving skills   Preferred  Good level knowledge of Linux environment Good working knowledge on YAML, Python  Automation/Implementation experience   Role Description Design, develop, and implement Terraform configurations for provisioning and managing cloud infrastructure across various platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP etc.). Collaborate with developers, DevOps engineers, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and design optimal infrastructure solutions. experience with Terraform, including writing and deploying infrastructure configurations. Strong understanding of IaC principles and best practices. Proficiency in scripting languages like Python or Bash for writing Terraform modules and custom functionality. Document Terraform configurations for clarity and maintainability. Personal Besides the professional qualifications of the candidates, we place great importance in addition to various forms personality profile. These include: High analytical skills A high degree of initiative and flexibility High customer orientation High quality awareness Excellent verbal and written communication skills   About Infosys Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 46 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through the many next of their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise and ideas from our innovation ecosystem. Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys can help your enterprise navigate your next. All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit, competence and performance. We are committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Deploying IaaS and PaaS infrastructure in AWS, Azure, or GCP using Terraform, Ansible, or similar Infrastructure-as-Code tools. - 10%  Providing L1/L2 support for various areas including cloud, VMware, Nutanix, VxRail, DC operations, server lifecycle management, VDI/AVD support, infrastructure cleanup, backup, storage, DR ops, patching, event/incident management, app secret/cert management, and refresh/upgrades.- 10% Skills/Requirements: Education:  Bachelors degree with a demonstrated interest in technology, technology issues, and analytical analysis. Preferred: Vendor Certifications a plus: Python, PowerShell, Bash, Terraform. Experience Required:  Minimum 5 to 8 years experience with scripting languages (PowerShell, Java, Python), configuration management (Ansible, Puppet, Chef), and Infrastructure-As-Code tools (Terraform, Ansible).  Experience applying automation across technical operations.  Working experience with Kubernetes, Linux, virtualization, networking, Ansible, OpenStack, OpenShift, git, Maven, and security technologies. Preferred:  Experience with infrastructure and application monitoring tools such as DataDog, vCenter, Ops Manager, and New Relic.  Experience with service management and incident response systems such as         ServiceNow and PagerDuty.   Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:  Solid knowledge of administering Windows and Linux Servers.  Sound understanding of Active Directory/DNS.  Working experience in installing, upgrading, patching, troubleshooting, and monitoring.  Working experience with building and automating CI/CD chains.  Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.  Strong communication skills (oral and written).  Results-oriented approach to projects and tasks.  Passion for automation and cloud technologies with a proven track record of delivering results. Preferred:  Ability to identify and enforce AWS, Azure, and GCP best practices.  Understanding of Agile and DevOps methodologies is desired.

column2: The Role As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer with a focus on Security at HashiCorp, you will spearhead initiatives to ensure our infrastructure and cloud products adhere to the highest standards of security, compliance, and governance. With over 6 years of experience in site reliability engineering or a related field, you will play a critical role in integrating security practices into our operational processes, enhancing our overall security posture. Key Responsibilities Security and Compliance: Lead efforts to maintain and enhance security compliance across all cloud services, ensuring adherence to industry standards and regulatory requirements. Infrastructure Security: Implement and manage security tools and practices, including automated compliance checks, to safeguard our infrastructure and applications. Incident Response: Coordinate with the security team to respond to and remediate security incidents promptly, minimizing impact and ensuring continuous service availability. Governance and Policy: Develop and enforce policies related to licensing, compliance, and governance, working closely with legal and compliance teams to navigate complex regulatory landscapes. Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with engineering, operations, and product teams to embed security considerations in the development and deployment lifecycle. Monitoring and Reporting: Establish comprehensive monitoring for security metrics, reporting on compliance status, and identifying areas for improvement. Ideal Candidate 6+ years of experience in site reliability engineering, security engineering, or a closely related field, with a strong focus on security practices. Expertise in security compliance frameworks (e.g., SOC 2, GDPR, HIPAA) and cloud security best practices in AWS, Azure, GCP, or similar platforms. Familiarity with infrastructure as code (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation) and automation tools for security compliance checks. Strong analytical skills, capable of identifying and mitigating security risks before they impact operations. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex security concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders. Experience with incident response and security operations in a cloud-based environment. #LI-hybrid

column1: Senior IT DevOps Engineer (Senior Azure Platform Engineer)
column2: Note: In order to proceed further, it is mandatory to apply for this job through our career site. For applying, please use Requisition # 14254  When visionary companies need to know how their world-changing ideas will perform, they close the gap between design and reality with Ansys simulation. For more than 50 years, Ansys software has enabled innovators across industries to push boundaries by using the predictive power of simulation. From sustainable transportation to advanced semiconductors, from satellite systems to life-saving medical devices, the next great leaps in human advancement will be powered by Ansys. Innovate With Ansys, Power Your Career.   Summary / Role Purpose The Sr. Azure Platform Engineer is a cloud computing expert who is responsible for designing, deploying, and managing applications and services on the Microsoft Azure platform. Azure Engineers work with developers, architects, and other stakeholders to ensure that the cloud solutions meet the business needs. This individual will play a key role in developing standardized DevOps CI/CD processes and reusable components using Infrastructure-as-Code.  The role requires execution of tactical day-to-day initiatives as well as contributing to the fulfillment of the long-term Enterprise Architecture strategy and in support of our long-term digital transformation initiatives. Key Duties and Responsibilities Infrastructure Provisioning and Management: Design, implement, and maintain cloud infrastructure and services using Azure resources such as logic apps, storage accounts, databases, app services, containers, networking, security, and automation. Develop and execute scripts and templates to automate the provisioning, configuration, and deployment of cloud resources and applications using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform, Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates, Biceps, or Azure CLI/PowerShell scripts. Manage Azure subscriptions, resource groups, and role-based access control (RBAC). Managing an entire Zone within our Enterprise Azure Subscription. System Administration and Monitoring: Perform system administration tasks such as patching, updates, and configuration management for Azure resources. Monitor and troubleshoot the performance, availability, and security of cloud solutions using solutions like Azure Monitor, Log Analytics, and Application Insights. Monitor system performance, availability, and health metrics, and respond to alerts and incidents. Implement security best practices, including network security groups, Azure Firewall, and Azure Security Center. Monitor and manage our Azure cloud costs and monthly consumption to ensure adherence to budgetary constraints. Provide L3 support as needed. Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity: Implement disaster recovery and business continuity strategies using Azure services like Azure Backup, Azure Site Recovery, and Azure Traffic Manager. Test and validate disaster recovery plans and procedures. Automation and DevOps: Collaborate with developers and architects to design and implement cloud-native applications and microservices using Azure DevOps and CI/CD tools and practices. Integrate Azure services with DevOps tools and practices for continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD). Implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and configuration management solutions for consistent and repeatable deployments. Automate deployment processes using Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, or other CI/CD tools. Minimum Education/Certification Requirements and Experience Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering or related field. A minimum of 8+ years related experience. Demonstrated ability working in collaborative team environment with other engineers and architects, setting priorities, and achieving results Deep understanding of Microsoft Azure services, architecture, and best practices. Experience with DevOps principles and practices, including continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD), automation, monitoring, and infrastructure as code (IaC). Proficiency in using CI/CD tools such as Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar for automating software delivery processes. Strong skills in scripting languages (e.g., PowerShell, Bash) and familiarity with automation tools (e.g., Terraform, Ansible). Knowledge of container technologies (e.g., Docker) and orchestration platforms (e.g., Kubernetes). Understanding of cloud networking architectures, cloud security best practices, and tools to protect and manage cloud resources and data. Ability to manage projects efficiently, working under deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Experience with Agile and Scrum methodologies is often preferred. Works independently with minimal supervision Preferred Additional Skills: Azure Certifications such as Azure Fundamentals (AZ-900), Azure Administrator Associate (AZ-104), Azure Solutions Architect Expert (AZ-303 and AZ-304), or Azure DevOps Engineer Expert (AZ-400) are preferred. At Ansys, we know that changing the world takes vision, skill, and each other. We fuel new ideas, build relationships, and help each other realize our greatest potential in the knowledge that every day is an opportunity to observe, teach, inspire, and be inspired.  Together as One Ansys, we are powering innovation that drives human advancement . Our Commitments: Amaze with innovative products and solutions Make our customers incredibly successful Act with integrity Ensure employees thrive and shareholders prosper Our Values: Adaptability: Be open, welcome whats next Courage: Be courageous, move forward passionately Generosity: Be generous, share, listen, serve Authenticity: Be you, make us stronger Our Actions: We commit to audacious goals We work seamlessly as a team We demonstrate mastery We deliver outstanding results OUR ONE ANSYS CULTURE HAS INCLUSION AT ITS CORE We believe diverse thinking leads to better outcomes. We are committed to creating and nurturing a workplace that fuels this by welcoming people, no matter their background, identity, or experience, to a workplace where they are valued and where diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging thrive. At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary leaders across the globe. Collectively we strive to change the world with innovative technology and transformational solutions. With a prestigious reputation in working with well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head on. Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology, empowering our customers to turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at a lower cost. At Ansys, its about the learning, the discovery, and the collaboration. Its about the whats next as much as the mission accomplished. And its about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can, and do impact real people in real ways. All this is forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy, and ethics. CREATING A PLACE WERE PROUD TO BE Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a member of the NASDAQ-100. We are proud to have been recognized for the following more recent awards, although our list goes on: Americas Most Loved Workplaces, Gold Stevie Award Winner, Americas Most Responsible Companies, Fast Company World Changing Ideas, Great Place to Work Certified (China, Greece, France, India, Japan, Korea, Spain, Sweden, Taiwan, U.K.). For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com Ansys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. Ansys does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of Ansys. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

column2: Role : Azure IaC Developer Location: Hyderabad, Work from office (5days) Job Description: As an Azure Infrastructure as Code (IaC) Developer , you will play a critical role in designing, implementing, and maintaining infrastructure automation solutions using Azure services and Infrastructure as Code principles. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to define infrastructure requirements, develop reusable templates, and automate deployment processes. This role requires strong expertise in Azure services, Infrastructure as Code tools, and software development best practices. Key Responsibilities: Design, develop, and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC) templates using Terraform. Collaborate with infrastructure architects and DevOps engineers to define infrastructure requirements and translate them into automated deployment scripts. Implement best practices for infrastructure provisioning, configuration, and management using IaC principles. Automate deployment and configuration of Azure resources, including virtual machines, databases, networking components, and storage services. Ensure the security, scalability, and reliability of infrastructure automation solutions by adhering to Azure best practices and compliance standards. Implement monitoring and logging solutions to track infrastructure changes, detect anomalies, and troubleshoot issues. Work closely with development teams to integrate infrastructure automation into the continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline. Collaborate with security and compliance teams to implement security controls and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements. column2: Job Summary As a Vulnerability and Patching Specialist , you will play a crucial role in ensuring the security posture of our organization by identifying, assessing, and remediating vulnerabilities across our systems and servers. Job Responsibilities Vulnerability Management : Utilize vulnerability scanning tools and techniques to identify vulnerabilities within our infrastructure, applications, and systems.  Risk Assessment:  Analyse the severity and potential impact of identified vulnerabilities to prioritize remediation efforts effectively.  Patch Management:  Develop and implement patch management processes to ensure timely deployment of security patches and updates across all systems and devices.  Remediation Planning:  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement remediation plans, including coordinating patch deployments, system upgrades, and configuration changes.  Security Best Practices : Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging threats, and best practices related to vulnerability management and patching.  Incident Response:  Assist in incident response activities related to security vulnerabilities, including investigation, analysis, and resolution.  Documentation and Reporting : Maintain comprehensive documentation of vulnerability assessments, remediation activities, and patching processes. Prepare regular reports for management and stakeholders on the status of vulnerabilities and patching efforts.  Continuous Improvement:  Continuously evaluate and improve vulnerability management and patching processes, tools, and workflows to enhance the overall security posture of the organization. Qualification/Requirements: Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Security, or related field (or equivalent experience). Solid understanding of networking concepts, operating systems, and security technologies. 4-5 yrs. of experience with vulnerability scanning and patching tools such as Nessus, Qualys, Patch Manager plus, Windows Server Update Service-WSUS or similar. Knowledge of HCL BigFix will be an added advantage. Proficiency in scripting and automation (e.g., Python, PowerShell) for vulnerability assessment and patch management tasks. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks effectively. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams and departments. Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CEH, or CompTIA Security+ are a plus.
column11: Nessus, vulnerability assessment, patching, Qualys
