column2: About Blackhawk Network At Blackhawk Network, we shape the future of global branded payments through the prepaid products, technologies, and networks that connect brands and people. Our collaborative innovation and scalable, security-minded solutions help our partners to increase reach, loyalty, and revenue. We believe our future holds great things for Blackhawk Network and its partners. We believe that together, we can shape the future. Our beliefs? Win as one team, be innovative, global excellence and be inspiring!  So, what are you waiting for? Shape your career and join our global network.  Overview    Blackhawk Network is building a digital platform and products that bring people and brands together. We facilitate cross channel payments via cash-in, cash-out and mobile payments. By leveraging blockchain, smart contracts, serverless technology, real time payment systems, we are unlocking the next million users through innovation. Our employees are our biggest assets! Come find out how we engage, with the biggest brands in the world. We look for people who collaborate, who are inspirational, who have passion that can make a difference by working as a team while striving for global excellence.  As a leader in branded payments, we are building a strong diverse team and expanding in ASIA PACIFIC we are hiring in Bengaluru, India! This is an amazing opportunity for problem solvers who want to be a part of an innovative and creative Engineering team that values your contribution to the company. If this role has your name written all over it, please contact us apply now with a resume so that we explore further and get connected.x As a Sr Enterprise Application Engineer, with ITSM, ITOM, Service Portal and CSM experience, you will play a critical role in designing, developing, and implementing ServiceNow modules and integrate ITSM/ITOM solutions. Your expertise in ServiceNow development, coupled with your knowledge of ITSM, ITOM and CSM processes, will be instrumental in driving digital transformation and improving operational efficiency within our organization. Responsibilities:   ServiceNow Development: Design, configure/develop, test, and implement ServiceNow solutions to meet business requirements, including custom applications, workflows, and integrations. ITSM & ITOM Enhancement: Leverage your deep understanding of IT Service Management (ITSM) processes to develop solutions to integrate new applications within platform using existing data model and leveraging OOB capabilities of Tasks, workflows, CMDB. Customization: Customize ServiceNow modules, forms, fields, and templates to align with our organization's specific needs and requirements. Automation: Create and maintain automation scripts, business rules, and orchestration workflows to optimize IT processes and reduce manual intervention. Documentation: Document design specifications, development changes, and configurations to maintain a comprehensive knowledge base. Best Practices: Stay up to date with industry best practices and emerging ServiceNow trends to recommend and implement improvements. Qualifications   Bachelor's in Computer Science or equivalent  4+ years of development/configuration experience on the ServiceNow platform including Hands on experience in Client & Server-side Scripting, Glide record, etc. Enterprise/large Service Management implementation experience Hands on experience beyond ITSM , SAM, ITOM, CSM ,Service Portal Development experience in other languages would be beneficial with aptitude to learn new technology quickly. Effective documentation skills and ability to work independently and as part of a team. Demonstrated understanding of ITIL practices Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills
column11: Servicenow Development, ServiceNow developer, ITSM & ITOM, Glide record

column2: Role & responsibilities     Strategic Direction and Roadmap for Cloud Platforms and DevOps : Make informed decisions on the strategic direction and roadmap for the use and implementation of cloud platforms and DevOps methodologies. Develop cloud architecture strategies in alignment with business objectives, leveraging a deep understanding of cloud services and technologies. Comprehensive Cloud Strategy Development : Create a well-informed, in-depth cloud strategy and manage its adaptation process. Design and implement scalable, resilient, and secure cloud solutions to meet organizational needs, considering factors such as performance, cost, and compliance. Organizing and Developing Cloud Systems : Organize and develop cloud systems. Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, define cloud migration strategies, and develop roadmaps for cloud adoption. Collaboration for Cloud Privacy Monitoring : Closely work with IT security teams to monitor clients cloud privacy. Provide guidance and expertise to development teams on cloud-native application design, deployment, and optimization. Collaborate with security teams to implement and maintain robust cloud security controls, including identity and access management, encryption, and network security. Partnership for Infrastructure Design : Work closely with internal data teams and business intelligence partners to help design the next version of our infrastructure. Establish and enforce cloud architecture best practices, standards, and policies to maintain a secure and compliant cloud environment. Technical Issue Management : Deal with technical issues in a timely and professional manner. Conduct regular assessments and reviews of cloud architecture, identifying areas for improvement and implementing solutions to optimize performance and cost-effectiveness. Guidance in Infrastructure Movement Techniques : Provide guidance and advice in infrastructure movement techniques, such as bulk application transfers to the cloud. Drive automation and orchestration initiatives to streamline cloud deployment, management, and operations. Identification of Best Cloud Architecture Solutions : Identify the best cloud architecture solutions for specific strategic business needs of client companies. Lead the evaluation and selection of cloud providers, services, and tools, ensuring they meet technical requirements and business goals. Stay updated on emerging cloud technologies, trends, and best practices, and assess their potential impact on the organization's cloud strategy. Preferred candidate profile     Bachelors/masters degree in computer science or similar related field such as information technology or computer engineering; 3 - 5 years of experience in supporting, executing, and designing IT cloud solutions In-depth knowledge of current cloud computing technologies and trends Effective verbal and written communication skills  Optional qualifications: Proficiency with Azure and Google Cloud technologies

column2: Job Title: RPA Lead Experience Level: 8 to 12 Years Location: India Notice Period: Immediate / 15 days Mode of Work: Hybrid Job Type: Contract to Hire About the Company:  [Insert brief description of the company and its mission.] Job Description:  We are seeking an experienced RPA Lead to join our team in India. The ideal candidate will have 8 to 12 years of experience and will be responsible for implementing infrastructure solutions leveraging Azure services. This is a fantastic opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and drive innovation in a dynamic environment. Key Responsibilities: Design and deploy virtual networks, subnets, load balancers, and firewalls using Azure networking components. Utilize Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform or Bicep to manage infrastructure automation. Implement containerization and orchestration with Docker and Kubernetes on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS). Apply strong security principles using Azure Active Directory/DC for identity and access management, implement role-based access control, and leverage encryption best practices. Configure Azure Monitor and utilize tools like Prometheus and Grafana for comprehensive monitoring and logging of applications and infrastructure. Manage and deploy databases like SQL Managed Instance, PostgreSQL, or NoSQL databases using Azure Database services. Perform capacity analysis, cost optimization, and implement strategies to reduce cloud spending. Troubleshoot and resolve cloud-related issues effectively. Stay up to date with evolving Azure technologies, continuously learn and experiment with new Azure services and offerings, and actively participate in the Azure community. Required Skills and Experience: 4+ years of hands-on experience working with Azure, with a deep understanding of core Azure services like VMs, networking, storage, databases, and security solutions. Expertise in at least one infrastructure as a code tool: Terraform, Bicep, or equivalent. Proficiency with Docker and Kubernetes: Experience deploying and managing containerized applications in Azure. Strong understanding of cloud security practices: Identity and access management, encryption (TDE), and vulnerability management. Experience with monitoring and logging tools: Azure Monitor, Prometheus, Grafana, or ELK stack. Solid understanding of networking concepts: Expertise in designing and managing virtual networks in Azure. Competence in scripting languages: PowerShell, Bash, or Python for automation tasks. Good knowledge of databases: Managing and deploying relational and NoSQL databases in the cloud. Analytical and problem-solving skills: Ability to diagnose and resolve cloud-related issues. Continuous learning and knowledge sharing: Passion for staying updated with the latest Azure trends and contributing to the community. Bonus Points: Experience with Spring Framework, GIT, and unit testing. Exposure to other cloud platforms like AWS or GCP. Experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices, especially for Java-based projects.

column2: IT Technical Analyst  Network Infrastructure   No. of Positions: 3   Top 3 Strong Cisco R/S experience. HMI uses Nexus 7000 series switches, ASR routers, ASA firewall, V-Sphere for virtualization, F5 Load Balancers, HP and Cisco UCS blade chassis. Wireless design and implementation experience. Cisco WLC based, 2602 APs global network, 250 APs. Support guest access at all sites. Someone that comes with hands-on experience from a large enterprise background (5000+ Employees) will be preferred. Description Network Engineer will be responsible for the design and implementation of the network used by Herman Miller, Inc. Key design goals include reliability, serviceability, and scalability. Provides technical support for the network switches, routers, cable plant, and RF equipment infrastructure devices used to enable communications within the corporation. Recognized for network expertise and sought as a resource for resolution of unique complex networking problems. RESPONSIBILITIES Install and maintain network devices. Monitor the network environment and resolve network problems required to share on-call support, i.e., 24x7 phone support. Develop and maintain network documentation and educate team members. Assist in network planning, engineering, architecture, and the development of standards. Evaluate moderately complex existing network systems and make recommendations for improvement. Develop detailed network specifications and configure network devices. Assist in the evaluation of requests for new or modified network connectivity. Document network, procedures and processes completely and accurately. Interface with vendors to identify and purchase hardware/software and evaluate new products as assigned. Recommend alternative solutions to reduce costs or improve service and reliability. Provide network expertise and knowledge to other members of the team in resolving complex network problems. Plan network projects involving multiple disciplines, impacting multiple business units. Evaluate user requests and identify requirements. Establish priorities. Perform additional requirements as operations may require in support of achieving business objectives. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS Bachelor's degree in Information technology preferred or equivalent.  10+ years of experience is essential. Cisco CCNA (Cisco Certified Network Associate) Certification. Ten+ years of network experience. Very strong oral and written communication skills. Transaction Control Protocol/Internet Protocol (TCP/IP) network experience. Experience with Cisco, Juniper networking and software. Working experience with wireless (802.11x) communications. Experience with network management software and network tuning tools, i.e., Wireshark, Observer, Orion and utilities. Strong teamwork skills, e.g., ability to work with others during stressful problem-solving activities, open to other's ideas. Demonstrates systemic thinking; excellent attention to detail. Ability to manage own time and to work on several tasks simultaneously. Customer focused; ability to be proactive, e.g., provide advance notice of potential problems or issues. Excellent problem-solving skills; resolve problems quickly and efficiently. Able to work flexible hours and in shifts; weekend and Sunday testing and coverage will be required as necessary; share 24x7 on-call support with other team members on rotation. Able to travel (10% up to 20% may be required). Ability to effectively use office automation, communication, software, and tools currently used in the Herman Miller office environment. Ability to perform all essential functions of the position with or without accommodation. Work environment: Great place to work. Pretty low-key and supportive place to work, but candidate must be able to work under duress if the network goes down. Technical Environment :  Core Nexus 7009, 5548, with fex distribution to the middle of row Datacenter servers are 85% Virtualized V-Sphere, HP and Cisco UCS blade chassis plus IBM, and SUN/Os.  Main OS is Windows server, HP/UX, AIX and Solaris. Storage is fiber channel and IP based, 10G and 1G connectivity. EMC and NetApp (managed by storage team) Main firewalls Cisco ASA, load balancers F5 Big-IP, IPS tipping point, WAN acceleration Riverbed, Routing Nexus, 3945 and ASR. Edge Cisco 4507, 3750X, 2960 Campus Ring Private fiber 10G, Cisco 6509E, with same edge devices Wireless Cisco WLC based, 2602 APs global network, 250 APs, we support guest access at all sites. Datacenters are located in Holland, UK, and Hong Kong. Disaster recovery node hosted at IBM, New York. WAN remotes (total 60 locations including W Michigan sites) Cisco 2901/29xx routing, 3750, 3750X, 2960 switching, router based firewall, Cisco 2602 APs, split tunnel VPN and MPLS. NS Infoblox in US, Windows DC based at remote sites. Network monitoring - Orion in W Mich, Orion in UK, Netflow, IPSLA, Monitoring, Configuration management Phone systems - No Cisco VoIP. Use Avaya, Nortel & Lync messaging. Use Service Now for tickets, change management and ITSM processes. Clients are 98% Windows 7, MAC, RF Intermec. Remote access is Juniper SSLVPN, mail is OS365 cloud hosted. Major applications for ERP are BaaN and Syteline (International)   Technical Environment: Nexus 7000 series switches, ASR routers, ASA firewall, V-sphere for virtualization, F5 Load Balancers, HP and Cisco UCS blade chassis. Non-Technical We need someone well-rounded, easy to get along with, and eager to help-out. Candidate must be organized, have excellent communication skills, be able to set priorities and have thorough documentation skills. HMI places high importance on honesty and integrity. Collaborative environment, but must be able to work under duress and make decisions. For example, if a production line goes down in a plant, the Engineer needs to have a high sense of urgency and stay calm while troubleshooting the issue. Interview process HR Screening Technical screening with local hiring manager and Infrastructure Lead in India Technical screening with Remote Manager and peers Optional: 2nd round evaluation if required. Please note : Atleast one or more of these rounds could be physical face to face interviews.     Herman Miller is an equal opportunity employer.

column2: Greetings from Ahana systems and solutions. We have an immediate opening for  *Job Title: Linux Administrator L3 * *Job Description:* *Overview:*  As a Linux Administrator L3 specializing in Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL),  responsible for managing and maintaining the Linux infrastructure of the organization. Work closely with other IT teams to ensure the smooth operation of all Linux-based systems and applications. *Responsibilities:* 1. *System Administration:*      - Deploy, configure, and maintain RHEL servers, ensuring optimal performance, security, and availability.     - Perform system upgrades, patching, and troubleshooting to resolve issues promptly.     - Monitor system performance and resource utilization, implementing necessary optimizations. 2. *Security Management:*     - Implement and maintain security measures to protect Linux systems from unauthorized access and potential threats.     - Conduct regular security audits and vulnerability assessments, and apply necessary patches and updates.     - Configure and manage firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, and other security tools. 3. *Backup and Recovery:*     - Develop and maintain backup and recovery strategies for Linux systems, ensuring data integrity and availability.     - Perform regular backups and test recovery procedures to minimize downtime in case of system failures or disasters. 4. *Scripting and Automation:*     - Develop scripts and automation tools to streamline routine tasks and improve system efficiency.     - Utilize scripting languages like Bash, Python, or Perl to automate repetitive tasks and workflows. 5. *Troubleshooting and Support:*     - Provide L3 support to resolve complex technical issues related to Linux systems and applications.     - Collaborate with other teams to diagnose and troubleshoot cross-functional issues, ensuring timely resolution. 6. *Documentation and Reporting:*     - Maintain detailed documentation of system configurations, procedures, and best practices.     - Generate regular reports on system performance, security incidents, and compliance status. *Requirements:* - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.  - Extensive experience (08+ years) working as a Linux Administrator, with a focus on Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL).  - In-depth knowledge of RHEL system administration, including installation, configuration, and troubleshooting.  - Strong understanding of Linux security principles and best practices.  - Proficiency in scripting languages such as Bash, Python, or Perl.  - Experience with virtualization technologies (e.g., VMware, KVM) and containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) is a plus.  - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.  - Relevant certifications (e.g., RHCE, RHCSA, LPIC) are highly desirable. Interested?? please send across the updated CV to career@ahanait.com/roopa.m@ahanait.com

column2: Job Title: Google Maps Specialist Job type: Fulltime/Freelancing/Consultant Job location: Nagpur Job Summary: As a Google Maps Specialist, you will play a key role in maintaining and improving the accuracy, completeness, and functionality of Google Maps. You will work with a team of engineers, data analysts, and product managers to ensure that Google Maps provides users with the most relevant and up-to-date information about locations, businesses, and points of interest worldwide. Responsibilities: Data Verification and Validation : Verify the accuracy of location data, business listings, and other information on Google Maps through manual checks and automated tools. Quality Assurance : Conduct quality assurance testing to identify and rectify errors, inconsistencies, and usability issues in Google Maps. Content Management : Manage and update location information, business attributes, and other content on Google Maps using internal tools and platforms. User Feedback Analysis : Analyze user feedback and reports to identify trends, areas for improvement, and opportunities to enhance the Google Maps experience. Cross-functional collaboration : Collaborate with engineering, product, and operations teams to address technical challenges, prioritize feature development, and implement product enhancements. Data Analysis and Insights : Analyze geographic data, user behavior patterns, and market trends to inform decision-making and improve the relevance and usefulness of Google Maps. Documentation and Training : Document processes, best practices, and guidelines for maintaining data quality and accuracy on Google Maps. Provide training and support to internal teams and external partners as needed. Compliance and Policy Adherence : Ensure compliance with relevant data privacy regulations, content policies, and geographic restrictions in all aspects of Google Maps operations. Innovation and Experimentation : Stay informed about emerging technologies, industry trends, and competitor offerings. Propose and experiment with new features, tools, and approaches to enhance Google Maps. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in geography, GIS (Geographic Information Systems), computer science, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred. Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and identify patterns and trends. Proficiency in programming languages such as  Python, JavaScript, SQL,  and  Dotnet  or others commonly used for data processing and automation. Experience with GIS software, mapping tools, and data visualization techniques. Experience with data analysis, quality assurance, or content management in a technology or internet-related industry. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Familiarity with Google Maps and other mapping/navigation platforms is a plus. Note:  This job description is intended to convey the general nature and level of work expected of this position. It is not exhaustive and may be supplemented as necessary to reflect the evolving needs of the organization and the Google Maps product. Contact: hr2@appynitty.com

column2: The Senior Directory Services (DS) Engineer is responsible for executing the enterprise-wide strategy for MetLife s directory services, which includes Identity Access Management, Oracle LDAP, Microsoft LDS, and Microsoft Active Directory. Additionally, DS engineering/operations is responsible for supporting automated user provisioning, authentication (i.e., Kerberos, ADFS. This hands-on position requires a subject matter expert (SME) with strong collaboration skills to work with cross functional teams to ensure the design of technology solutions complies with MetLife s information security policies and regulatory obligations.                     The Senior DS Engineer must be an adaptable, pragmatic, and positive professional, who is comfortable in delivering clear and concise information at both a technical and managerial level. We are seeking a dynamic individual for this SME role that will execute MetLife s transformation in digital and mobile space and accelerate customer centricity initiatives.                         Now is an exciting time to be a part of MetLife - start your next career journey with us. In this role you will make an impact by standardizing customer directories, collaborating with business partners on common identities and exploring new technologies for virtual directories.                           Facilitate Active Directory administrative tasks, integration needs, and business requirements.                     Creation, migration, consolidation, and retirement of Domain Controllers into sites and domains.                     Collaborate with Information Security Division to mitigate vulnerabilities, define and implement security policies, and support internal PKI/certificate management process.                     Configuring Active Directory Site and Services according to Microsoft and industry best practices.                     Test and verify AD Domain Controllers disaster recovery procedures.                     Execute monitoring strategies for monitoring and reporting health of Active Directory components.                     Be available to all information technology groups of a large enterprise, both within IT operations as well as in other IT divisions to help and facilitate the integration or support of the Active Directory and Microsoft Enterprise Services.                     Continually monitor environment to ensure best practices and Federal guidelines are being followed.                     Generate usage reports of components of AD like LDAP, NTLM, Kerberos, etc.                     Provide point in time audit reports of different types of AD objects.                     Create and maintain support documentation, asset inventory, and tracking of the enterprise infrastructure.                     Work closely with desktop and server administrators to define and execute appropriate Group Policy, scripting, related to directory hierarchy, objects, and structure.                              Job Responsibilities                         Support quarterly patching of the infrastructure includes OUD, Java, WebLogic, OEM and manage OS related issues and supports all the global regions and environments.                      Provide L1 and L2 support with LDAP/OUD/PING related technology and escalate to L3 team.                      Support Ping one directory services.                      Ability to fine tune the infrastructure, monitoring, problem resolution and identification of root cause.                     Ability to troubleshoot issues with Splunk monitoring tools and create proactive dashboards/ alerts.                     Build and deploy Microsoft Active Directory Domain Controllers, consolidate Sites and Domains, and monitor the health of existing systems                     Provide ongoing Level 2 and Level 3 support for MetLife s directory services, which includes: upgrades, tuning, monitoring, problem resolution and identification of root cause.                     Establish collaborative working relationships with the businesses, functions, and regions to ensure that MetLife s directory services align with MetLife s security architecture and business strategy.                     Work with global partners to migrate end users from mergers & acquisitions into MetLife s directories.                     Responsible for day-to-day administration duties including Windows Active Directory object maintenance, troubleshooting and repair tasks on Active Directory, Windows Server 2019, Domain Controllers, DNS, user authentication and other operational systems as needed.                     Implement, monitor, and maintain Active Directory DC design, Schema, OU design, AD replication topology, and DC backup/restore procedures                     Develop and maintain backup and recovery practices and procedures                     Perform Active Directory Services administration and management to include design, cleanup and routine maintenance and configuration                     Handle requests via thru Incident/Problem Management tool                     Ability to coordinate and perform Disaster Recovery exercises.                     Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS), SAML, web Single Sign-on (SSO), OAuth and related authentication technologies                         Knowledge, Skills and Abilities                           Education                       Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.                     Experience                     8+ years of LDAP design, Ping and migration or consolidation experience                     8+ years of Active Directory design and domain migration or consolidation experience                     5+ years of scripting skills in PowerShell or other modern scripting language                     5+ years of Linux Operating System experience                      5+ years of experience with Azure Cloud Services.                     Advanced Microsoft certification with 8+ years experience as a Windows 2012/2016/2019 and Active Directory services administrator.                     Hands-on experience in supporting Microsoft Windows 2012/2016/2019 core systems, Active Directory, ADFS, MS PKI, DFS, and GPO validation and design.                     Deep understanding of Group policy management, troubleshooting and management.                     Understanding of the inner working of Active Directory and its components.                     Working experience of lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP).                     Deep understanding of Active Directory Federation Services.                       Knowledge and skills        (general and technical)                     Prior experience with other directory technologies like Ping, Tivoli, OpenDJ or virtual directories                     8+ years engineering experience working in an enterprise infrastructure with a minimum of 20,000 end users                     Experience in developing and supporting system management automation tools to deploy, configure and monitor servers and services.                     Thorough understanding of monitoring best practices for Active Directory and related services. Must possess excellent communication, presentation, and writing skills.                         Other Requirements            (licenses, certifications, specialized training - if required)                       Power Shell, VB Script is a plus.                     ITIL, MCP, MCSE, MCSA, Azure Certification will be preferred.

column2: Overview:  We are seeking an experienced IT Server and DevOps Manager to lead our infrastructure and operations team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in managing server environments, implementing DevOps practices, and ensuring the reliability, scalability, and security of our IT infrastructure. This role requires both technical expertise and leadership skills to drive continuous improvement and innovation within our organization. Responsibilities: 1.          Infrastructure Management: Oversee      the design, implementation, and maintenance of our server infrastructure,      including physical and virtual servers, storage systems, and networking      equipment. Ensure      the availability, performance, and security of our IT systems through      proactive monitoring, troubleshooting, and capacity planning. Manage      relationships with vendors and service providers to procure hardware,      software, and services as needed. 2.          DevOps Implementation: Lead      the adoption of DevOps practices within our organization, including  continuous integration, continuous delivery, and infrastructure as code. Automate  deployment, configuration, and monitoring processes to streamline  operations and improve efficiency. Collaborate      with development teams to integrate automated testing and deployment      pipelines into the software development lifecycle. 3.          Team Leadership: Recruit,      mentor, and develop a high-performing team of infrastructure engineers and      DevOps specialists. Provide      technical guidance, coaching, and support to team members to foster their      professional growth and success. Foster      a culture of collaboration, innovation, and accountability within the      infrastructure and operations team. 4.          Security and Compliance: Implement      security best practices and controls to protect our IT infrastructure and      data assets from internal and external threats. Ensure      compliance with relevant regulations, standards, and industry best      practices, such as GDPR, HIPAA, and ISO 27001. Conduct      regular security assessments and audits to identify vulnerabilities and      address security gaps. 5.         Continuous Improvement: Drive      process improvements and operational excellence initiatives to enhance the      reliability, efficiency, and agility of our infrastructure and operations. Evaluate      new technologies and tools to stay abreast of industry trends and emerging      best practices. Measure      and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) to track the effectiveness      of our infrastructure and operations processes. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field;  Master's degree preferred. 6-8  years of experience in IT infrastructure management, with a focus on      server administration and DevOps practices. Proven experience leading and managing a team of infrastructure engineers and DevOps specialists. Strong      technical skills in server virtualization, cloud computing,      containerization, and automation tools (e.g., VMware, AWS, Docker,      Kubernetes, Terraform, Ansible). Solid      understanding of networking, security, and compliance requirements in a      corporate IT environment. Excellent      communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with      cross-functional teams and senior leadership. Certifications      such as AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Certified Kubernetes Administrator      (CKA), or Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) are      a plus. Key Responsibilities: Manage the design, implementation, and maintenance of the company's server      infrastructure. Lead  the adoption of DevOps practices and automation tools to improve      operational efficiency. Recruit,  mentor, and develop a high-performing team of infrastructure engineers and      DevOps specialists if required. Ensure the security, availability, and scalability of the company's IT systems. Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance the reliability and  performance of our infrastructure and operations.

column2: Are you a problem solver, explorer, and knowledge seeker  always asking, ??hat if???If so, you may be the new team member we are looking for. Because at SAS, your curiosity matters ??whether you are developing algorithms, creating customer experiences, or answering critical questions. Curiosity is our code, and the opportunities here are endless. What we do  We??e the leader in analytics. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence. Our curiosity fuels innovation, pushing boundaries, challenging the status quo and changing the way we live. What you??l do   SAS CloudOps division is an innovation team that applies the latest technologies to continuously improve customer experience and optimize operational efficiencies. Do you seek out innovative technologies and find the best way to apply them? Do you enjoy the challenges of integration of complex workflows while simplifying the customer experience? Do you find yourself championing solving problems through code? If so, the SAS CloudOps team would like to talk to you. As a Manager of CloudOps, you will have the opportunity join a team of engineers that are developing a new cloud-native platform to deliver ??alue added SAS Services via self-service automation??to SAS internal and external customers. You will help guide the architecture and implement complex orchestration across global cloud providers. A strong aptitude for continuous learning and rapidly implementing modern technologies is required. Additionally, this role requires a holistic view of managing skilled development teams, architecture, applied development, operations, performance, security, and costs on modern cloud providers.  You will: Manage a team of engineers and developers to build and operate the SAS CloudOps platform architecture, components, and APIs. Take ownership of projects with minimal guidance. Be responsible for building and maintaining business partnerships including collaboration around expectations and deliverables for IT technology efforts. Be responsible for ensuring prioritized technology efforts are staffed and executed using the appropriate methodologies and standards. Effectively identifies, manages, mitigates and escalates risk to all levels of management. Keep group members informed, manages administrative aspects of the department including personnel matters. Sets performance goals/standards/objectives for the team. Performs all management responsibilities for the team including coaching and fostering growth and development. Optimize workflows for cloud native developed solutions for performance and cost efficiency. What we are looking for: Required: Management and leadership skills. Strong knowledge of Cloud service providers such as Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Provider. Working knowledge of a variety of IT concepts and trends, best practices, procedures, security, integration and quality assurance techniques. Strong knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle methods and standards. Strong ability to manage multiple, parallel work efforts; effectively manage competing priorities and mitigate obstacles. Ability to build a high-performance team through staff forecasting, interviewing, hiring, performance evaluations, disciplinary action and coaching, mentoring, training, inspiring and motivating employees. Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal skills. The nice to haves: Previous people management experience. Experience with emerging technologies such as Kubernetes and Open Source technologies. Experience developing cloud native solutions on AWS, Azure or GCP Proficiency with application development. Education and Experience: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or some other related field. Five or more years of relevant experience in an enterprise  Equivalency: Equivalent combination of education, training, and relevant experience may be considered in place of the requirements stated above. The level of this position will be determined based on the applicant's education, skills and experience. Why SAS: We??e the leader in analytics. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence. Our curiosity fuels innovation, pushing boundaries, challenging the status quo and changing the way we live.  We love living the #saslife and believe that happy, healthy people have a passion for life, and bring that energy to work. No matter what your specialty or where you are in the world, your unique contributions will make a difference.   Our multi-dimensional culture blends our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. Here, it isn?? about fitting into our culture, it?? about adding to it - and we can?? wait to see what you??l bring. SAS looks not only for the right skills, but also for a cultural fit. We seek colleagues who will contribute to the unique culture that makes SAS such a great place to work. We look for the total candidate: technical skills, culture fit, relationship skills, problem solvers, good communicators and, of course, innovators. Candidates must be ready to make an impact.
column11: CloudOps, Cloud Development, Cloud Native, Cloud Operations, Cloud Deployment, Cloud Applications, Cloud Architecture, Cloud Migration, Cloud Infrastructure

column2: Hi, Greetings from WTW! If interested, please reach out to malvika.mishra@wtwco.com and don't reply back on this ID  Role Description: As an Identity Engineering Lead, you will be responsible for evolving a complicated global hybrid environment to a cloud first environment by advancing the design and implementing modern comprehensive Identity and Access Management (IAM) and Privileged Access Management (PAM) strategies adhering to company standards and requirements.  Key Responsibilities:? ??Your overall strategy will include modernization, zero-trust, and simplification where possible. Your role will include oversight and support for ongoing migration activity of existing AD Infrastructure to Cloud with focus to streamline and evolve current environments and processes. ??Evolve and maintain the IAM and PAM frameworks, ensuring they align with industry best practices and regulatory requirements. ??Lead the design and implementation of identity solutions that support both on-premises and cloud environments. ??Collaborate with IT and security teams to integrate identity management solutions with existing systems and applications. ??Manage the full lifecycle of digital identities, including provisioning, de-provisioning, and access reviews. ??Define and enforce access policies and procedures, including least privilege and separation of duties principles. ??Oversee the deployment of PAM tools and technologies, ensuring secure management of privileged accounts. ??Conduct regular audits and compliance checks related to identity and access controls. ??Provide leadership and guidance to the identity engineering team, setting clear goals and performance metrics. ??Stay abreast of emerging security threats and technologies, adjusting strategies as necessary. Key Responsibilities:  ??Your overall strategy will include modernization, zero-trust, and simplification where possible. Your role will include oversight and support for ongoing migration activity of existing AD Infrastructure to Cloud with focus to streamline and evolve current environments and processes. ??Evolve and maintain the IAM and PAM frameworks, ensuring they align with industry best practices and regulatory requirements. ??Lead the design and implementation of identity solutions that support both on-premises and cloud environments. ??Collaborate with IT and security teams to integrate identity management solutions with existing systems and applications. ??Manage the full lifecycle of digital identities, including provisioning, de-provisioning, and access reviews. ??Define and enforce access policies and procedures, including least privilege and separation of duties principles. ??Oversee the deployment of PAM tools and technologies, ensuring secure management of privileged accounts. ??Conduct regular audits and compliance checks related to identity and access controls. ??Provide leadership and guidance to the identity engineering team, setting clear goals and performance metrics. ??Stay abreast of emerging security threats and technologies, adjusting strategies as necessary. Qualifications: ??Bachelor?? degree in computer science, Information Security, or a related field. ??Minimum of 9 years??experience in identity management and security, with at least 2 years in a leadership role. ??Strong understanding of IAM and PAM concepts, methodologies, and technologies. ??Experience with identity management platforms such as Okta, SailPoint, or Microsoft Azure Active Directory. ??Knowledge of scripting and automation tools for efficient identity management. ??Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure. ??Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to lead cross-functional teams. column2: The Senior Directory Services (DS) Engineer is responsible for executing the enterprise-wide strategy for MetLife s directory services, which includes Identity Access Management, Oracle LDAP, Microsoft LDS, and Microsoft Active Directory. Additionally, DS engineering/operations is responsible for supporting automated user provisioning, authentication (i.e., Kerberos, ADFS. This hands-on position requires a subject matter expert (SME) with strong collaboration skills to work with cross functional teams to ensure the design of technology solutions complies with MetLife s information security policies and regulatory obligations.                     The Senior DS Engineer must be an adaptable, pragmatic, and positive professional, who is comfortable in delivering clear and concise information at both a technical and managerial level. We are seeking a dynamic individual for this SME role that will execute MetLife s transformation in digital and mobile space and accelerate customer centricity initiatives.                         Now is an exciting time to be a part of MetLife - start your next career journey with us. In this role you will make an impact by standardizing customer directories, collaborating with business partners on common identities and exploring new technologies for virtual directories.                           Facilitate Active Directory administrative tasks, integration needs, and business requirements.                     Creation, migration, consolidation, and retirement of Domain Controllers into sites and domains.                     Collaborate with Information Security Division to mitigate vulnerabilities, define and implement security policies, and support internal PKI/certificate management process.                     Configuring Active Directory Site and Services according to Microsoft and industry best practices.                     Test and verify AD Domain Controllers disaster recovery procedures.                     Execute monitoring strategies for monitoring and reporting health of Active Directory components.                     Be available to all information technology groups of a large enterprise, both within IT operations as well as in other IT divisions to help and facilitate the integration or support of the Active Directory and Microsoft Enterprise Services.                     Continually monitor environment to ensure best practices and Federal guidelines are being followed.                     Generate usage reports of components of AD like LDAP, NTLM, Kerberos, etc.                     Provide point in time audit reports of different types of AD objects.                     Create and maintain support documentation, asset inventory, and tracking of the enterprise infrastructure.                     Work closely with desktop and server administrators to define and execute appropriate Group Policy, scripting, related to directory hierarchy, objects, and structure.                              Job Responsibilities                         Support quarterly patching of the infrastructure includes OUD, Java, WebLogic, OEM and manage OS related issues and supports all the global regions and environments.                      Provide L1 and L2 support with LDAP/OUD/PING related technology and escalate to L3 team.                      Support Ping one directory services.                      Ability to fine tune the infrastructure, monitoring, problem resolution and identification of root cause.                     Ability to troubleshoot issues with Splunk monitoring tools and create proactive dashboards/ alerts.                     Build and deploy Microsoft Active Directory Domain Controllers, consolidate Sites and Domains, and monitor the health of existing systems                     Provide ongoing Level 2 and Level 3 support for MetLife s directory services, which includes: upgrades, tuning, monitoring, problem resolution and identification of root cause.                     Establish collaborative working relationships with the businesses, functions, and regions to ensure that MetLife s directory services align with MetLife s security architecture and business strategy.                     Work with global partners to migrate end users from mergers & acquisitions into MetLife s directories.                     Responsible for day-to-day administration duties including Windows Active Directory object maintenance, troubleshooting and repair tasks on Active Directory, Windows Server 2019, Domain Controllers, DNS, user authentication and other operational systems as needed.                     Implement, monitor, and maintain Active Directory DC design, Schema, OU design, AD replication topology, and DC backup/restore procedures                     Develop and maintain backup and recovery practices and procedures                     Perform Active Directory Services administration and management to include design, cleanup and routine maintenance and configuration                     Handle requests via thru Incident/Problem Management tool                     Ability to coordinate and perform Disaster Recovery exercises.                     Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS), SAML, web Single Sign-on (SSO), OAuth and related authentication technologies                         Knowledge, Skills and Abilities                           Education                       Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.                     Experience                     8+ years of LDAP design, Ping and migration or consolidation experience                     8+ years of Active Directory design and domain migration or consolidation experience                     5+ years of scripting skills in PowerShell or other modern scripting language                     5+ years of Linux Operating System experience                      5+ years of experience with Azure Cloud Services.                     Advanced Microsoft certification with 8+ years experience as a Windows 2012/2016/2019 and Active Directory services administrator.                     Hands-on experience in supporting Microsoft Windows 2012/2016/2019 core systems, Active Directory, ADFS, MS PKI, DFS, and GPO validation and design.                     Deep understanding of Group policy management, troubleshooting and management.                     Understanding of the inner working of Active Directory and its components.                     Working experience of lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP).                     Deep understanding of Active Directory Federation Services.                       Knowledge and skills        (general and technical)                     Prior experience with other directory technologies like Ping, Tivoli, OpenDJ or virtual directories                     8+ years engineering experience working in an enterprise infrastructure with a minimum of 20,000 end users                     Experience in developing and supporting system management automation tools to deploy, configure and monitor servers and services.                     Thorough understanding of monitoring best practices for Active Directory and related services.                     Ability to translate technical issues into understandable business language for end users and other technical support personnel.                     Must possess excellent communication, presentation, and writing skills.                         Other Requirements            (licenses, certifications, specialized training - if required)                       Power Shell, VB Script is a plus.                     ITIL, MCP, MCSE, MCSA, Azure Certification will be preferred.

column2: Job Description: **Job Title: AWS Cloud Operations Lead** **Location:** Bengaluru **Position Overview:** We are seeking a highly skilled AWS Cloud Lead with expertise in AWS Infrastructure services. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in governance, compute, networking and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) automation. The candidate should possess strong leadership skills and the ability to design, implement, and manage AWS cloud solutions effectively. This role requires a total experience between 4-6 years, with at least 2 years of hands-on experience in AWS cloud services. **Key Responsibilities:** - Work on implementation, deployment and optimization of AWS cloud infrastructure services. - Provide operational support adhering to defined SLA and KPI. - Establish and enforce governance policies and procedures to ensure compliance and security within the AWS cloud environment. - Design and implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC) automation (CloudFormation, Terraform) for provisioning, configuring, and managing AWS resources. - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and address infrastructure requirements and challenges. - Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior team members. - Experience with scripting languages to automate operational tasks. - Stay updated with the latest AWS services, features, and best practices to continuously improve cloud infrastructure. **Qualifications:** - Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. - 4-6 years of experience in IT, with at least 2 years of hands-on experience in AWS cloud services. - Must have atleast 2 years of experience with Cloud Operations. - Must have atleast 2 years experience with AWS compute, storage, container, database and operations services. - Strong expertise in networking concepts and technologies, including VPC, Route 53, VPN. - Proficiency in AWS governance frameworks and best practices for security, compliance, and cost optimization. - Extensive experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as CloudFormation and Terraform. - Solid understanding of DevOps principles and experience with CI/CD pipelines. - AWS certifications such as AWS Certified SysOps Administrator is highly desirable. - Excellent communication and leadership skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams. - Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. **Additional Information:** - column2: Job Description: Mid to Senior AWS Infrastructure Engineer Overview:  We are seeking a highly skilled AWS Infrastructure Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of AWS services and infrastructure management, with a focus on scalability, reliability, and security. You will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and maintaining our AWS infrastructure to support our growing business needs. Primary Responsibilities: Design, deploy, and manage AWS infrastructure solutions,      including but not limited to EC2 instances, VPCs, S3 buckets, RDS      databases, and IAM roles. Implement automation using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools      such as Terraform or CloudFormation to streamline deployment and      configuration processes. Ensure high availability, fault tolerance, and scalability of      AWS services by implementing best practices and monitoring tools. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements,      architect solutions, and provide technical guidance. Troubleshoot infrastructure issues and performance bottlenecks,      and implement solutions to mitigate risks and optimize performance. Implement security best practices and compliance standards to      protect sensitive data and ensure regulatory compliance. Document infrastructure configurations, procedures, and      troubleshooting steps to maintain a reliable knowledge base. Additional Responsibilities: Provide mentorship and guidance to junior team members to      foster their professional growth. Stay updated on emerging AWS services, technologies, and best      practices to continuously improve our infrastructure solutions. Participate in on-call rotations and respond to incidents in a      timely manner to ensure service availability and reliability. Good to Have Skills: Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker      and Kubernetes. Knowledge of networking concepts and experience with      configuring and troubleshooting network infrastructure on AWS. Familiarity with DevSecOps practices and tools such as Git,      Jenkins, and Ansible. Experience with monitoring and logging tools such as      CloudWatch, ELK stack, or Prometheus. Certification in AWS (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect,      AWS Certified DevOps Engineer) is a plus. Skills and Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a      related field. Equivalent work experience may be considered. 5+ years of experience in designing, deploying, and managing      AWS infrastructure. Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python, Bash, or      PowerShell. Strong understanding of cloud computing principles and AWS      services. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Effective communication and collaboration skills. Skill Matrix:   Skills Proficiency Level   AWS   Services (EC2, VPC, S3, RDS) Advanced   Infrastructure   as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation) Advanced   Automation   Tools (Ansible, Jenkins) Intermediate   Containerization   (Docker, Kubernetes) Intermediate   Networking   on AWS Intermediate   Monitoring   and Logging Intermediate   Security   and Compliance Advanced   Scripting   (Python, Bash) Advanced   Problem-Solving Advanced   Communication Advanced Screening Questions: Do you have experience designing, deploying, and managing AWS      infrastructure solutions, including EC2 instances, VPCs, S3 buckets, RDS      databases, and IAM roles? Have you implemented automation using Infrastructure as Code      (IaC) tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation for deployment and      configuration processes? Can you demonstrate your experience ensuring high availability,      fault tolerance, and scalability of AWS services by implementing best      practices and monitoring tools? Have you collaborated with cross-functional teams to gather      requirements, architect solutions, and provide technical guidance for AWS      infrastructure projects? How do you approach troubleshooting infrastructure issues and      performance bottlenecks on AWS, and can you provide examples of solutions      you've implemented? Have you implemented security best practices and compliance      standards to protect sensitive data and ensure regulatory compliance in      AWS environments? Do you have experience mentoring and providing guidance to      junior team members to foster their professional growth? Are you proactive in staying updated on emerging AWS services,      technologies, and best practices to continuously improve infrastructure      solutions? Have you participated in on-call rotations and responded to      incidents in a timely manner to ensure service availability and      reliability? Do you have experience with containerization technologies such      as Docker and Kubernetes, and how have you integrated them with AWS      services? Can you demonstrate your knowledge of networking concepts and      experience with configuring and troubleshooting network infrastructure on      AWS? Are you familiar with DevSecOps practices and tools such as      Git, Jenkins, and Ansible, and have you used them in AWS environments? Have you worked with monitoring and logging tools such as      CloudWatch, ELK stack, or Prometheus in AWS environments? Do you hold any certifications in AWS, such as AWS Certified      Solutions Architect or AWS Certified DevSecOps Engineer? Can you demonstrate proficiency in scripting languages such as      Python, Bash, or PowerShell, and how have you used them in AWS      infrastructure management? Can you explain how you approach problem-solving in complex AWS      infrastructure scenarios, and provide examples of successful resolutions? How would you rate your communication and collaboration skills,      and can you provide examples of how you've effectively communicated      technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders? Preferred candidate profile   Perks and benefits

column2: Position: Senior Cloud Engineer Job Description: We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Cloud Engineer with expertise in Linux and Windows Systems Administration, coupled with extensive experience in Cloud Administration across multiple platforms including Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Microsoft Azure, and OpenStack. As a Senior Cloud Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and managing cloud infrastructure to support our organization's growing needs. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of cloud services, optimize performance, and enhance security measures. Mission: To work on various technologies to build / run cloud solutions and to mentor & coach junior team members.  Key accountabilities:  Cloud Infrastructure Design: Design and architect cloud-based solutions tailored to meet the organization's requirements, ensuring scalability, reliability, and cost-effectiveness.  Implementation and Deployment: Lead the implementation and deployment of cloud infrastructure, utilizing best practices and automation techniques to streamline processes and improve efficiency.  Systems Administration: Provide expert-level support for Linux and Windows systems, including installation, configuration, troubleshooting, and performance tuning.   Cloud Administration: Manage and maintain cloud environments on GCP, Azure, VMware and OpenStack, including provisioning resources, monitoring system health, and optimizing performance.  Security Compliance: Implement and enforce security policies and best practices to ensure the integrity and confidentiality of data stored in the cloud environment and adhere to compliance standards.   Automation and Orchestration: Develop automation scripts and workflows to automate routine tasks, improve deployment speed, and enhance system scalability.  Monitoring and Performance Optimization: Monitor system performance, analyze metrics, and implement optimizations to ensure optimal performance and resource utilization.   Disaster Recovery and Backup: Design and implement robust disaster recovery and backup strategies to safeguard critical data and applications against potential disruptions.   Collaboration and Documentation: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and provide technical expertise and maintain comprehensive documentation for all cloud infrastructure and processes.   Continuous Learning and Innovation: Stay abreast of emerging technologies and industry trends related to cloud computing, and proactively identify opportunities for innovation and improvement within the cloud environment.   Provide L3 support for run activities of Cloud infrastructure solutions.  Contribute to the best practices definition and documentation of the Cloud solutions. Expected Skills (some can be acquired on the job):   Proficiency in Linux and Windows systems administration, including command-line proficiency and scripting skills (e.g., Shell, PowerShell).   Proficiency in VMware Infrastructure administration, including vCenter, vCloud Director, PowerCLI. ??Proficiency in Kubernetes and Containerization, including Cluster Administration, Deployments and Troubleshooting.  Extensive experience with cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Microsoft Azure, and OpenStack, including hands-on experience with cloud services (compute, storage, networking, etc.).   Strong understanding of networking concepts and protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VPN, etc.).  Experience with automation tools such as Terraform, Ansible.   Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues in a timely manner.  Strong communication skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.  System administration and Cloud infrastructure engineering skills ??Expertise in Linux System Admin and Bash Scripting   Basic Familiarity with Platform Engineering concepts, Crossplane & common GitOps tools e.g., FluxCD or ArgoCD  Strong hand-on knowledge of Ansible, Terraform and Infrastructure automation.  Good troubleshooting skills  Good command on Networking, firewall, storage.  Educational Qualifications ??B.Tech (Computer Science/IT/Electronics& Telecommunications), MCA, MSC in Computer science, Information Technology, or related field.  Certifications Desired: ??Google Cloud Certified - Professional Cloud Architect, ??Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert,  Relevant Experience ??5+ years of technical expertise in above mentioned activities with a focus on cloud infrastructure and systems administration.

Privaceras solution enables a single pane of glass for enterprise visibility of data and enables centralized controls over data in the cloud. Privacera is growing rapidly via the intersection of the two hottest trends in the enterprise?industry;? enterprise data moving into the public cloud, and the need for security, governance, privacy which are becoming table stakes in every industry.? Previous experience in EDA/engineering HPC environments, understanding the unique demands and challenges   of high-performance computing. column2: ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES   As a Cloud Infrastructure Support   Lead, you will be responsible for overseeing and managing the day-to-day   operations of the cloud infrastructure support team. This role requires a   deep understanding of cloud technologies, excellent leadership skills, and   the ability to ensure the stability, security, and scalability of our cloud   infrastructure.  Team        Leadership: Provide leadership, guidance, and mentorship to a team of cloud         support engineers. Foster a collaborative and high-performance team environment. Set clear objectives, performance expectations, and conduct         regular performance evaluations. Cloud        Infrastructure Management: Manage and maintain cloud infrastructure resources, ensuring         high availability, performance, and security. Oversee the provisioning, configuration, and optimization of         cloud resources (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Implement best practices for cost optimization and resource         utilization. Expertise in AKS cluster setup and configuration with HA and DR Experience with infrastructure as code tools (automated         provisioning) such as ARM templates or terraform. Incident        Management: Lead incident response efforts, ensuring timely resolution of         infrastructure-related incidents. Collaborate with other IT teams and stakeholders to minimize         downtime and service disruptions. Security        and Compliance: Enforce security best practices and compliance standards for         cloud infrastructure. Stay updated on the latest security threats and implement         necessary measures to protect cloud resources. Monitoring        and Automation: Implement monitoring and alerting solutions to proactively         identify and address performance issues. Develop and maintain automation scripts and tools for routine         tasks and resource provisioning. Capacity        Planning: Monitor resource usage and plan for scalability based on         business growth and demand. Ensure resources are provisioned efficiently to avoid         unnecessary costs. Documentation        and Training: Maintain comprehensive documentation of cloud infrastructure         configurations and procedures. Provide training and knowledge transfer to team members and         end-users as needed. Vendor        Management: Collaborate with cloud service providers and third-party vendors         to resolve technical issues and optimize services. Manage vendor relationships, contracts, and service level         agreements (SLAs). Continuous        Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and cost         reduction in cloud operations. Stay updated on emerging cloud technologies and recommend their         adoption where appropriate. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology,         or a related field (or equivalent work experience). Proven experience around 7 to 10 Yrs in cloud infrastructure         management and support. Strong knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or         Google Cloud. Proficiency in scripting and automation (e.g., Python,         PowerShell). Experience with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g.,         Docker, Kubernetes). Excellent problem-solving and communication skills. Strong leadership and team management abilities. Relevant certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions         Architect, Azure Administrator)  The Cloud Infrastructure Support Lead plays a critical role in         ensuring the reliability and performance of our cloud-based services.         This position requires a strategic mindset, technical expertise, and         the ability to lead a skilled team in a dynamic and fast-paced         environment. Provide L2-L3 level support to manage service support team, in         case required Audit finding points closure and improvement into existing         infra. Documentation related to compute, storage and DC relation         activities (ISO, ISMS, reviews) Support in new project roll-out, new technology and upgrades. Ensure adherence to IT Security initiatives, policies, and         guidelines Service Level management - KPI monitoring

column2: Role & responsibilities   1. Solution Design and Architecture: Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather requirements, analyze business processes, and define solution architectures for SharePoint-based solutions. Design SharePoint sites, lists, libraries, workflows, and custom applications to meet business needs.   2. SharePoint Development: Develop custom SharePoint solutions using SharePoint Framework (SPFx), SharePoint Designer, PowerShell, and other development tools. Customize SharePoint sites, master pages, page layouts, web parts, and custom forms using client-side and server-side development techniques.   3. Integration and Data Migration: Integrate SharePoint with other enterprise systems, applications, and data sources using SharePoint APIs, web services, and third-party connectors. Perform data migration tasks to import/export data between SharePoint and external systems.   4. Workflow Automation: Design and implement SharePoint workflows using SharePoint Designer, Microsoft Power Automate (formerly Flow), or third-party workflow automation tools. Automate business processes, approvals, notifications, and document management workflows to streamline operations.   5. SharePoint Governance and Security: Implement SharePoint governance policies, permissions management, and security controls to ensure data integrity, confidentiality, and compliance with regulatory requirements. Define role-based access controls (RBAC), user permissions, and document retention policies.   6. SharePoint Administration: Perform SharePoint administration tasks, including site provisioning, user management, content migration, and server maintenance. Monitor SharePoint farm health, performance metrics, and usage statistics using SharePoint Central Administration and monitoring tools. 8. SharePoint Customization and Branding: Customize SharePoint sites and portals with custom branding, themes, and styles to align with organizational branding guidelines and user experience (UX) design principles. Implement responsive design techniques for mobile-friendly SharePoint sites.   Preferred candidate profile   1. Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field, or equivalent work experience. 2. Proven experience as a SharePoint Developer or similar role, with expertise in designing, developing, and customizing SharePoint solutions. 3. Strong understanding of SharePoint architecture, features, and capabilities, including SharePoint Online (Office 365) and SharePoint Server. 4. Proficiency in SharePoint development tools and technologies, including SharePoint Framework (SPFx), SharePoint Designer, JavaScript, HTML/CSS, and C#/.NET. 5. Experience with SharePoint REST API, CSOM (Client-Side Object Model), and PowerShell scripting for automation and administration tasks. 6. Knowledge of SharePoint migration tools and techniques for migrating content from legacy systems to SharePoint environments. 7. Familiarity with SharePoint governance, information architecture, and best practices for site design, taxonomy, and content organization. 8. Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot complex SharePoint-related issues independently. 9. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with business stakeholders, users, and IT teams. 10. Microsoft Certified: SharePoint Developer certification or similar credentials are preferred. Loc: Pune or Hyderabad N.P - Immediate to 45 days

We are a leading FTSE100 Financial Services company with businesses in the UK, Europe and America. We set up in 1993 as a car insurance specialist, but since then we have expanded into other countries and other services such as price comparison, home and travel insurance, Insurtech, personal loans, car finance and legal services. Our history is one of growth, profitability, and innovation. When we launched in 1993, we had just one brand, zero customers and 57 members of staff. We now have over 11,000 colleagues and 7 million customers worldwide. We are proud to have our headquarters and UK offices in south Wales as well as businesses in Spain, Italy, France and the US. column2: Job description : The Cloud Network Engineer is responsible for the public and private cloud network architecture and security. This position requires strong experience with Cloud technologies; AWS, Azure, and others along with proven knowledge in cloud-specific networking, including VPC/VNET design, VPC/VNET peering, VPN Gateways, Cloud VPN, NAT Gateways, VGW, Cloud Load Balancers, Security Groups, Traffic Manager, Direct Peering, direct connect/Cloud Interconnect/ ExpressRoute and other cloud-related endpoints. Roles and Responsibilities : 1. Good working knowledge of public cloud environments such as AWS, Azure and GCP 2. Should be able to review the proposed architectures, providing feedback on deployment constraints based on previous deployment experience. 3. Should be able to provide technical delivery support to the network architects, delivering solutions and configurations to support application deployments. 4. Understanding of Zero-Trust Security Model 5. Understanding of MS Defender for Cloud and SIEM Tools (Sentinel, Splunk) 6. Understanding network concepts between on-premises vs hybrid vs cloud model 7. Understanding of automation and software-defined networking Technical Skills required 1. Core network skills (TCP/IP, DNS, Packet Capture, Routing protocols; BGP, OSPF, EIGRP) 2. Must have Hands-on experience in the configuration of VPN (Site-to-Site, Point-to-Site, Express Route) 3. Must have hands-on experience in Hub-Spoke Architecture, n-tier Architecture. 4. Must have hands-on experience on Azure Firewall, Azure Bastion, Azure DDOS Protection 5. Must have hands-on experience in configuration of Network Security Group, Application Security Group, VNets, User Defined Routes 6. Knowledge of Azure Policies, Azure Blueprints 7. Good knowledge of Private DNS Zone 8. Can troubleshoot and resolve the networking issues in the system. 9. Good knowledge of MS Defender for Cloud and Azure Sentinel 10. Experience with issue tracking and ticketing systems. 11. Good verbal and written communication skills 12. 3+ years of experience in Azure Networking and SecurityRole & responsibilities   In case of any queries please contact on kanan@celebaltech.com or call me on 7718917536

column2: The IT Service Specialist role is the core Service Desk role covering both HQ or MU s responsible for the entire range of services within incident management, request fulfilment and facility management. Besides this they also train users in best practices using the IT services from Group IT and facilitate IT needs for bigger events.     Role with the Service Desk lies within the three areas in terms of: incident management, request fulfilment and facility management.          Incident management: Provide technical support to end-users on software, applications, hardware, networks and other solutions provided by Group IT through tickets, phone and face-to-face support.          Request fulfilment: Order, manage, configure and deploy all types of personal computing devices and peripherals and perform application and operating system software installations and upgrades.          Facility management: Support, maintain and configure IT equipment in the physical offices like, printers, meeting rooms and course rooms.                What you will be responsible for:         Advanced technical support (phone, ticket and face-to-face) on all services in catalogue     IT equipment ordering, asset management, vendor management (e.g. ATEA and Insight)     Budget control together with local finance     IT facilitation of SimCorp eventsConfiguration and update of work devices; printer, work- and mobile device support     Control and maintain the loaner equipment stock     Meeting room support, check and verification     IT equipment decommissioning     Coordination of office moves, refurbishments and expansions     Advanced user administration, user representation in IT projects     IT Training of new employees and general IT information to users     Automation of processes     Coordination of upgrades and implementation of infrastructure components together with Infrastructure services             What we value (our requirements):         At least 3 years of experience from a similar position. Broad knowledge of Microsoft Platforms & Applications, Citrix, VM-ware, Azure, Salesforce, etc.     Can provide onsite 1st line support for internal users hardware.
