column1: Urgent opening || AWS Administrator || Insight Enterprises, Inc
column2: Responsibilities  Cloud Migration      Planning: Collaborate with clients and internal teams to assess their      existing infrastructure and applications, understanding their business      needs and technical requirements. Develop detailed migration plans and      timelines to move applications and data to the AWS cloud while minimizing      downtime and disruptions.  AWS Service Selection:      Utilize your in-depth knowledge of AWS services to recommend the most      appropriate solutions for each migration project. Consider factors such as      application architecture, data storage, security, and scalability while      choosing the right AWS services.  Environment Setup and      Configuration: Set up and configure AWS environments to support the      migration process. This includes creating virtual private clouds (VPCs),      network configurations, security groups, and other necessary components.  Data Migration: Design      and execute data migration strategies, ensuring the integrity and security      of the data during the transfer. Implement best practices for data      migration and validation to guarantee a successful migration.  Application Migration:      Manage the migration of various applications, databases, and workloads to      AWS. Address any compatibility issues and ensure that applications      function optimally in the cloud environment.  Automation and      Scripting: Leverage automation and scripting tools (e.g., AWS      CloudFormation, AWS CLI, etc.) to streamline migration processes and      reduce manual intervention wherever possible.  Security and Compliance:      Implement robust security measures and compliance practices during the      migration process. Ensure that all migrated resources adhere to industry      standards and best practices for security.  Performance      Optimization: Fine-tune AWS resources to optimize performance and      cost-efficiency, utilizing auto-scaling, load balancing, and other AWS      features as needed.  Troubleshooting and      Support: Provide technical support during and after migration, addressing      any issues that arise and resolving them in a timely manner.  Documentation and      Reporting: Create comprehensive documentation for migration projects,      including architectural diagrams, process flows, and post-migration      reports. Present project status and results to internal and external      stakeholders.  Cost Optimization:      Identify opportunities to optimize cloud costs for clients during the      migration process. Utilize AWS Cost Management tools to analyze and      recommend cost-effective solutions without compromising performance or      security.  Disaster Recovery      Planning: Develop disaster recovery strategies for migrated applications      and data, ensuring business continuity and data resilience in the AWS      cloud.  Continuous      Monitoring: Implement monitoring and alerting solutions to proactively      identify performance issues or potential security breaches, providing      quick response and resolution.  Cloud Optimization      Strategies: Propose and implement optimization strategies for existing AWS      environments, improving performance, reliability, and cost-effectiveness.  Risk Management:      Identify potential risks associated with cloud migrations and develop      mitigation plans to address them effectively.  Required Skills  Bachelors degree in      computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.  5-9 years of      professional experience in cloud computing, specifically with AWS      services.  AWS Infra Server and Application Migration, Database      Migration Landing zone Setup, On-premises Migration Cloud Designing  Architectural, AWS services      including EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, VPC. Automation ??Terraform or PowerShell, AWS Cloud      Formation. Candidate must have exposure with Client handling      and other clouds; Azure or GCP.
column11: Application Migration, Amazon Ec2, Vpc, Database Migration, Rds Postgresql, Lambda Aws

Experience in setting up and managing monitoring tools such as Dynatrace and familiarity with Databricks. Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. Strong communication and collaboration skills, capable of working effectively across different teams.

column2: Role & responsibilities     Key Responsibilities include: Cloud Platform Management: Mange design,      implementation, and management of cloud infrastructure on AWS, Azure, and      GCP.  Manage Design,      implementation, and maintenance of Azure infrastructure solutions, including virtual networks,      subnets, Azure Active Directory, Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates,      and Azure DevOps. Configure      and manage Azure virtual machines, virtual machine scale sets, Azure App      Service, Azure Functions, Azure SQL Database, Azure Storage, and other      Azure services. Automate      infrastructure deployment and management tasks using PowerShell, Azure      CLI, ARM templates, and other automation tools. Manage the provisioning and configuration of cloud resources      including networking and DNS configurations to ensure scalability,      security, and performance Design and implement disaster recovery solutions and backup      strategies for Azure resources, ensuring business continuity and data      protection. Foster effective communication channels within the DevOps team      and across other teams. Collaborate with application development teams to optimize      performance, scalability, and reliability of cloud-based applications      running on Azure. Participate in on-call rotation and respond to      infrastructure-related incidents and emergencies in a timely manner,      ensuring service availability and minimizing downtime. Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD): Manage CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins, Azure DevOps ensuring      seamless and automated deployment processes. Monitor sprint status and maintain a versions matrix for      efficient release management. Collaborate with development and QA teams to streamline the      deployment process and reduce deployment risk. Environments and Monitoring: Manage and maintain development, testing, and production      environments. Ensure high availability and reliability of systems through      proactive monitoring Implement and maintain health check endpoints and monitoring      and alerting Experience with Azure      monitoring and logging solutions, such as Azure Monitor and Azure Log      Analytics. Monitor Azure resources for performance, availability, and      security compliance, and troubleshoot and resolve any issues that arise. Knowledge of other monitoring tools preferred but not      mandatory, for e.x. Proven experience as a Infrastructure & DevOps Lead or      Manager, with a track record of successfully implementing and managing      DevOps practices. Strong expertise in the specified core DevOps tools and      technologies Solid understanding of cloud services, particularly AWS &      Azure and its networking  Experience with infrastructure as code (Terraform),      configuration management (Puppet), and CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, Azure      DevOps)  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Proactive problem-solving abilities and the ability to lead and      inspire a team Hands on experience in scripting and good knowledge on Python Relevant certifications (AWS Certified DevOps Engineer,      Microsoft Certified: Azure DevOps Engineer, Google Cloud Professional      DevOps Engineer) are a plus Candidate is required to mandatorily work in night shift (IST      9pm. to 6am.)

column2: Skill required:  Tech for Operations - Data Center Networking Technologies Operations Designation:  Senior Analyst Qualifications: Any Graduation,BE  Years of Experience: 5 - 8 Years  About Accenture Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security.Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Technology and Operations services, and Accenture Song all powered by the worlds largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 699,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities.Visit us at www.accenture.com  What would you do? You will be part of the Technology for Operations team that acts as a trusted advisor and partner to Accenture Operations. The team provides innovative and secure technologies to help clients build an intelligent operating model, driving exceptional results. We work closely with the sales, offering and delivery teams to identify and build innovative solutions. The Application Hosting Operations team enables customer success by offering managing hosting services (Infrastructure & Platform), dynamic data centers, expansion of existing services, product support, supplier management, and application operations. Infrastructure Services (IS) - AHO continuously works to extend TFO hosting and services portfolios with high value services, such as virtual machine, database, web, and desktop hosting with on demand virtualized servers and networking services. AHO's ability to differentiate and scale client requirements into multiple solution options propels client success and productivity into the future. The Data Center Networking Technologies Operations team uses set of tools that provides unified management capabilities across the Web Technologies Networking family of products including switches, routers, and WLAN equipment. They help offer a singular view of the network, allowing businesses to streamline and integrate workflows. What are we looking for? Network Infrastructures - Minimum of 5 years of hands on experience in managing network security infrastructure  Network Operations & Service Management  Ability to establish strong client relationship  Ability to manage multiple stakeholders  Ability to work well in a team-  Cloud Design and Build - Good To Have - Working knowledge/experience in Automation of Network Infrastructure Management Knowledge of Scripting language Python, Ansible, Perl, Bash, TCL etc  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of moderately complex problems  May create new solutions, leveraging and, where needed, adapting existing methods and procedures  The person would require understanding of the strategic direction set by senior management as it relates to team goals  Primary upward interaction is with direct supervisor  May interact with peers and/or management levels at a client and/or within Accenture  Guidance would be provided when determining methods and procedures on new assignments  Decisions made by you will often impact the team in which they reside  Individual would manage small teams and/or work efforts (if in an individual contributor role) at a client or within Accenture Qualification Any Graduation,BE

As a Principal Architect in Gen AI technology, you will work at the intersection of technology and industry knowledge, leveraging your expertise in generative AI tools to push the boundaries for building innovative solutions. Design scalable and efficient AI/ML/GenAI solutions considering deployment models and integration with existing tools that align with client needs and strategic goals. Pre-Sales Support: Assist the sales team in pre-sales activities by providing technical expertise, participating in client meetings, and contributing to proposal development. Translate client requirements into feasible Gen AI solutions. Collaboration: Collaborate with Enterprise, Application, Data, & DevOps Architects. Work closely with CTO, Data scientists, Prompt engineers and other stakeholders to ensure the successful implementation of Gen AI solutions. Use ML and Generative AI tools and other technologies to design, evangelize, and implement state-of-the-art solutions for never-before-solved problems. Define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions, with a focus on generative models and LLM. Drive successful business outcomes for educating, training, designing and building cloud hosted Generative AI solutions. Familiarity with architecture large-scale data processing and modeling Interact with customers directly to understand the business problem, help and aid them in implementation of their ML ecosystem. Ability to travel 25%, on average, based on the work you do and the clients and industries/sectors you serve. Strong collaborative and interpersonal skills, specifically a proven ability to effectively guide and influence within a dynamic matrix environment. Excellent problem-solving abilities and the ability to work independently or collaboratively in a team. column2: Job description The NOC Analyst is responsible for managing and maintaining the server infrastructure. This role involves ensuring the availability, reliability, and security of servers, as well as troubleshooting and resolving server-related issues. The NOC Analyst works closely with other teams and departments located remotely to support the customer's technology needs.   Roles and Responsibilities: Monitoring and Alert Response: Monitor clients' IT infrastructure, including servers, networks, and applications, using monitoring tools and platforms. Respond to alerts promptly, investigate issues, and take appropriate actions to resolve or escalate incidents based on impact and urgency. Incident Management: Handle incident tickets escalated from Level 1 support, troubleshooting technical issues, and providing timely resolution to minimize downtime and service disruptions. Collaborate with Level 3 support or client technical teams for complex issue resolution and root cause analysis. Proactive Maintenance: Perform routine maintenance tasks, such as patch management, system updates, and configuration changes, to ensure clients' systems are up-to-date and secure. Implement proactive measures to optimize performance, enhance security, and prevent potential issues. Security and Compliance: Monitor security events, conduct security assessments, and enforce compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements across clients' environments. Implement security measures, such as firewall configurations, antivirus updates, and access controls, to safeguard clients' data and infrastructure. Client Communication: Communicate effectively with clients to provide status updates, gather additional information about incidents, and ensure client satisfaction. Act as a point of contact for technical discussions, service requests, and incident escalations, always maintaining professional and responsive communication. Documentation and Knowledge Management: Maintain accurate documentation of client environments, configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps. Contribute to the knowledge base with best practices, solutions, and recommendations to improve efficiency and consistency in support delivery. Project Support: Assist with the implementation of IT projects, such as system migrations, upgrades, and deployments, providing technical expertise and support as needed. Coordinate with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure project objectives are met within defined timelines and budget constraints. Communication and Customer Service: Strong verbal and written communication skills to interact professionally with clients, internal teams, and vendors. Ability to translate technical information into non-technical terms for clients and stakeholders, facilitating effective communication and understanding. Team Collaboration: Collaboration skills to work effectively as part of a multidisciplinary team, sharing knowledge, providing support, and contributing to the collective success of the NOC. Willingness to mentor junior team members, share expertise, and participate in continuous learning and development activities. Adaptability and Problem-Solving: Adaptability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, managing multiple priorities and shifting focus as needed to address urgent issues and meet SLA requirements. Strong problem-solving skills to analyse complex technical problems, identify root causes, and develop effective solutions under pressure. Commitment to Quality and Security: Commitment to delivering high-quality services, maintaining operational excellence, and adhering to security best practices to safeguard clients' systems and data. Awareness of cybersecurity threats and proactive measures to mitigate risks, protect against vulnerabilities, and ensure clients' environments are secure and resilient.   Technical Certifications:   Microsoft Certified:  Windows Server Certification (e.g., MCSA, MCSE): Demonstrates proficiency in deploying, configuring, managing, and maintaining Windows Server environments.   VMware Certified Professional (VCP):  Demonstrates expertise in VMware virtualization technologies, including installation, configuration, administration, and troubleshooting of VMware vSphere environments.   ITIL Foundation Certification:  Provides an understanding of IT service management best practices, processes, and principles, which is beneficial for managing IT infrastructure and services effectively.   Job Type: Full-time   Benefits: Cell phone reimbursement Schedule: Rotational shift UK shift Supplemental pay types: Shift allowance. Yearly bonus

column1: Senior Executive - IT Infrastructure (Network and Security Admin)
column2: Key Responsibilities: Network Infrastructure Management: Hands-on experience with enterprise-class firewalls, routers, and switches, preferably on FortiGate Firewall and Forti Manager. Analysis and diagnosis of complex networking problems and network designs. Design, plan, and implement security measures to protect data, networks, and computer systems. Monitor server and computer networks, conduct regular security audits, and prepare security status reports. Configuration and management of IPSEC Site-to-Site VPN, remote-access VPN, and SSL VPN. Configuration and management of ACLs, NAT, Ether Channel, SPAN, and VLAN. Security Administration: Implement security profiles such as GAV, IPS, SSL decryption, web filtering, and application control. Monitor security events, perform traffic analysis, and troubleshoot security-related issues. Endpoint security management, including antivirus and patch management. Email security management, including message tracking, quarantine management, and security rules configuration. Vendor and OEM Management: Escalate issues to partners and OEMs, follow up on reported issues, and ensure timely closure. Perform actions recommended by OEMs, partners, or providers to resolve issues effectively. Documentation and Reporting: Create and provide detailed documentation and network drawings for network and security designs and configurations. Generate regular reports on network performance, security status, and endpoint security events.

column1: Senior Executive / Executive - Enterprise IT, Network Infra & Security
column2: Strategic Operations:    Overseeing the planning, management, and operation of technical systems resources and network infrastructure for the IT network. Leveraging expertise in network infrastructure management, information risk management, personnel management, as well as planning and budgeting to consistently deliver IT services at a high level of quality and consistency              Network Design and Management:    Designing and managing a high-performance IT network that enables efficient enterprise data traffic. Managing day-to-day technical operations, including IT systems, network support, high-performance computing, and storage, to align with the requirements of the media broadcast studio        Maintenance and Upgrades:    Conducting network maintenance and executing system upgrades, including service packs, patches, hot fixes, and security configurations        Device Configuration:    Configuring and installing various network devices and services, such as routers, switches, firewalls, load balancers, VPNs, and Quality of Service (QoS) components        Protocols Mastery: D   emonstrating a comprehensive understanding of networking protocols, encompassing IPSEC, HSRP, BGP, OSPF, 802.11 , and QoS        Hands-On Experience:    Applying hands-on experience with monitoring tools, network diagnostics, and network analytics to maintain and enhance network performance                      Who should apply?         The ideal candidate should have a Bachelors degree in Security or a related IT field (Masterswill be preferred).      Additionally, qualifications such as a postgraduate degree in Computers/IT Engineering or a Master of Computer Applications/MBA in Operations are highly regarded      They should have a minimum of 12 years of relevant IT experience in a similar job role. It would be beneficial if they have at least 3 years of experience in managing and leading teams and individuals. Experience in the Media industry is considered optional but valuable      Furthermore, possessing a CCNP or higher certification is required, while holding a CCIE and/or CISSP certification is highly valued      Hands on experience or working knowledge of most of the following security functions: multifactor authentication, identity and access control systems, identity governance systems, privileged access management, intrusion detection/prevention systems, patch management, Windows domain security, encryption and incident response.      Experience / understanding with Cloud infrastructure commissioning, administration and maintenance.      Operational understanding of Microsoft Windows, Apple Mac, Linux & UNIX platforms, network, system, storage and backup technologies in a high availability environment      Analytical and information gathering skills are a must.      Problem-solving skills including working collaboratively with peer Broadcast & Digital technical teams to resolve cross-platform problems or to develop security risk solutions      Candidates who understand the security risks associated to key business functions and possible means of exposures that could have business impact

column2: Lead the IT service operations and provide technical ownership of the eBusiness tools using within ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions. Primary responsibility will be managing the IT delivery aspects of the online platforms, ensuring seamless IT operations, overseeing the planning, development, implementation, and maintenance of our eBusiness applications.                      Develop a structured framework and operating model for the effective rollout of projects and support services, managing the plans and budgets, planning the lifecycle of the solutions. Own the integration architecture across the digital landscape and have a firm grasp on the interdependencies.                  RESPONSIBILITIES                        Team & Vendor Coordination:                            Manage the delivery partner on both project and support services, ensuring the IT service capability meets business demand, fostering collaboration and providing guidance to ensure efficient service delivery. Partner with eBusiness team to plan and deliver on demand. Coordinate the planning of commercial statement of works and tracking budget of all eBusiness IT spend.                            Vendor Management:                            Coordinate with external software vendors on licensing and demand, managing renewals, tracking and reporting to provide transparency. Manage service delivery providers to plan and optimize resources in line with business demand and budget.                            Technical Ownership & Platform Management:                            IT platform & technical ownership to ensure the stability and functionality of our eBusiness platforms. Overseeing day-to-day operations, maintenance, and enhancements, including updates, patches, and troubleshooting. Assess and integrate third-party solutions, ensuring compatibility and required functionality. Take hands on technical ownership of applications insourced for Managed Services.                            Planning & Change Management                            Plan, develop and deliver IT services to ensure appropriate controls and governance to allow the business to achieve the eBusiness strategy. Identify risks and suggest mitigations, working closely with the eBusiness leads and stakeholders to ensure milestones and deliverables for all assigned tasks are completed on time, within budget. Own the JIRA process, ensuring stories are progressing and controlled, and manage internal project deliveries where required on insourced initiatives.                            Continuous Improvement:                            Identify opportunities for enhancements, recommending and implementing new technologies or processes to improve efficiency & reduce technical debt.                            Compliance & Risk Management:                            Implement security measures to safeguard customer data and transactions. Stay abreast of industry standards, regulations, and best practices, ensuring platforms comply with necessary requirements.                            Service and SLA Optimization:                            Monitor service desk performance metrics, analyse trends, and implement improvements to enhance support services. Create knowledge base of supporting technical documentation.                  SELECTION CRITERIA            10+ years experience in related field is required. column2: Incedo is a US-based consulting, data science and technology services firm  with  over 2,000 people  helping clients from our  six offices across US and India . We help our clients achieve competitive advantage through end-to-end digital transformation. Our uniqueness lies in bringing together strong engineering, data science, and design capabilities coupled with deep domain understanding. We combine services and products to maximize business impact for our  clients in telecom, financial services, product engineering and life science & healthcare industries . Working at Incedo will provide you an opportunity to  work with industry leading client organizations, deep technology and domain experts, and global teams .  Incedo University , our learning platform, provides ample learning opportunities starting with a structured onboarding program and carrying throughout various stages of your career. A variety of fun activities are also an  integral part of our friendly work environment . Our  flexible career paths  allow you to grow into a program manager, a technical architect or a domain expert based on your skills and interests. Role & responsibilities:    Incident Management - Receiving, logging, prioritizing, and resolving IT-related   incidents and service requests from end-users. Providing timely and effective   solutions to minimize disruptions. Request Fulfilment - Handling service requests such as access provisioning,   software installations, and hardware replacements. Ensuring requests are   fulfilled within agreed-upon service levels. User Support - Providing frontline technical support to end-users. Assisting   with hardware and software issues and offering guidance on IT-related   inquiries. Problem Management - Investigating and resolving the root causes of recurring   incidents. Implementing corrective actions to prevent similar issues from   impacting users in the future. Change Management - Managing IT changes and ensuring they are implemented with   minimal disruption. Coordinating with other IT teams to plan, approve, and   execute changes in the IT environment. Knowledge Base Management - Maintaining and updating a knowledge base with solutions   to common issues, troubleshooting guides, and self-help resources. Empowering   end-users to resolve issues independently. Communication and Updates - Keeping end-users informed about service outages, system   upgrades, and other relevant information. Providing regular updates on the   status of ongoing incidents and service requests. User Access Management - Managing user access to IT systems and applications.   Creating, modifying, and disabling user accounts based on role changes, onboarding,   or offboarding processes. Training and Onboarding - Providing training and onboarding support for new   employees. Ensuring that users are familiar with IT policies, procedures, and   tools to promote efficient and secure IT usage. Remote Assistance and Support - Offering remote assistance and support to end-users.   Leveraging remote desktop tools and communication platforms to troubleshoot   and resolve issues without physical presence. Reporting and Metrics - Generating and analyzing service desk performance metrics   and reports. Monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify trends,   areas for improvement, and overall efficiency. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's      degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (or      equivalent work experience). Proven      experience in a similar IT support role. Strong      knowledge of Windows and/or Mac operating systems. Familiarity      with common business applications and productivity tools. Excellent      troubleshooting and problem-solving skills. Customer-oriented      with good communication skills. Ability      to work independently and collaboratively within a team. IT      certifications (e.g., CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certified Desktop Support      Technician) are a plus. Working Conditions: This      position may require occasional evening or weekend work to accommodate      maintenance and upgrades. Participation      in an on-call rotation for after-hours support may be required. Regards, Incedo HR Team

column2: The Specialist role will be responsible for the coordination of    activities associated with the Global IT Third Party Risk Management Program within MetLife s IT Risk and Security Organization                       Conduct vendor risk assessments over third party vendors, including but not limited to: determining the scope of the service provided by interacting with MetLife Senior Management; administering risk assessments directly to vendors using our online tool; examining responses to determine the extent of risk the relationship represents to MetLife; offering recommendations to MetLife Management on how to respond to any risks; and generating formal findings.                     Assess and respond to risk findings, including pursuing action plans to completion and negotiating due dates with vendors.                     Perform security assessments of systems, applications, data centers, and service providers using an established framework and tools to evaluate vulnerabilities. Research new and developing technologies and standards to help contribute to the continuous improvement of the risk assessment process.                     Act as a subject matter expert in understanding why certain risks a threat to the company are and how compensating or mitigating processes affect that risk.                     Provide Guidance on IT Security Requirements during Contract negotiation discussions.                                         Job Responsibilities                                         2 to 4 years of experience into IT risk security / and/or IT Audit experience to include reading and interpreting the results of audit reports (SSAE18, PCI ROC, etc), security assessments (penetration tests, vulnerability scans, etc                       Knowledge of information security standards and laws (eg, ISO 27001/27002,etc), and commonly used concepts, practices and procedures within the information security and privacy field                         Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, MIS, Information Systems, or related discipline                         Excellent communication skills and be able to write, speak and present to all levels of management                         Professional certification; such as CISA, CRISC, or CISSP Certifications preferred                       Strong organizational ethic to manage a large volume of competing tasks effectively.                       Direct experience developing, implementing, and improving technology controls in a corporate environment                       Sound concepts of Vendor Assessments and to manage existing work and also for providing value addition to existing work.                   Experience of working in a fast-paced organization that is focused on accountability (must deliver results)                 Experience working with all levels of an organization and be comfortable in presenting, interacting with, and taking direction from Senior Management                       Knowledge, Skills and Abilities                                       Education                     IT Graduate                   Spanish Dele B1 or above                                 Experience                   2-4 years of experience into IT risk security / and/or IT Audit experience                                  Knowledge and skills        (general and technical)                           Exposure to IT Archer Findings                                  Exposure to enterprise share-point                          Should have critical skills to perform deep dive analysis and perform investigations on info security risks                 Experience of working with onshore stakeholders and spearhead discussions with different vendors                 Ability to handle critical situations around updating reports, strategies etc                 Quick learning skills and meet the effort objectives with minimum guidance                 Flexible and adaptability to change                               Other Requirements            (licenses, certifications, specialized training - if required)                       CISA, CRISC, or CISSP Certifications preferred

column2: Duties and Responsibilities(tentative) Provides      strategic leadership and guidance at the executive level in critical areas      of technology administration having institution, state-wide and/or      national impact. Serves      on behalf of the CIO as the principal IT Officer, in the CIO's absence or      as requested. Oversees      cross-institutional initiatives and executive level projects, fostering      strategic partnerships in carrying out enterprise-wide computing services      for the central IT organization. Assists      the Chief Information Officer in leading overall information technology      strategic planning to achieve business goals by prioritizing information      technology initiatives and coordinating the evaluation, deployment, and      management of current and future technology projects. Assists      the Chief Information Officer in governance oversight, project and      portfolio management, and service delivery management. May      be responsible for directing key services within the division with      broad-reaching institutional and/or statewide impact. Provides      leadership for planning, developing, and implementing information      technology initiatives. Leads      the development and implementation of best practices and standards in      process, design, architecture and operations of all aspects of service      oriented information technology delivery. Directs      programs to monitor, evaluate and improve customer service delivery. Performs      miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned. Minimum Job Requirements At      least 15 years of experience directly related to the duties and      responsibilities specified. Completed      degree(s) from an accredited institution that are above the minimum      education requirement may be substituted for experience on a year for year      basis. column2: Roles and Responsibilities   Job description This is an exciting opportunity to join and be a part of our rapidly growing Azure practice. Candidates must have strong experience in design and development using Azure Integration Services. Required: Strong knowledge in designing and developing Azure Integration Services (AIS) including Logic Apps, Logic app Connectors, Azure Functions, Service Bus, Event Grid, Azure Data Factory, Azure Storage, Power Automate(Microsoft Flow) etc. Experience in building complex integration using Azure Logic App and Transformation(Map/Schema). Good understanding of integration architecture concepts and patterns, including Microservices, Service Oriented Architecture, Batch Integrations, RESTful JSON Services, Pub/Sub etc. including Event-Driven Architecture. Knowledge in Hybrid Integration using the Azure Platform. Migration of BizTalk Server integrations to Microsoft Azure (using Logic Apps, EIP, & Service Bus). Good to have knowledge of the API integration with external systems ERP or CRM. Testing suites like Postman, SoapUI is a must. Ability to review FSD (Functional Specification Document) and create TSD (Technical Specification Document) Execute and Document test results (Unit testing / Functional testing)Ability to work on defects Identified during system integration testing and user integration testing Ability to work within agile project setup is a must Familiarity with azure DevOps, CI/CD pipelines is added advantage Proficiency in the following tools are expected: 1. Azure Logic Apps, 2. Logic app Connectors, 3. Azure Functions, 4. Event Grid 5. API management, 6. Azure SQL Database, 7. Power Automate(Microsoft Flow). 8. Microsoft BizTalk Server (2013-R2 ) or higher version, ESB Toolkit (2.1) 9. C# Microsoft 10. .NET Framework 4.5+ 11. Visual Studio 12. Microsoft SQL Server Desired skill sets: Technical and Conceptual understanding must be demonstrated. Ability to use Microsoft Visio to represent development flows is a plus Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)

column2: Job Title: Service Desk - Lead Job Summary: We are seeking a highly experienced and skilled Service Desk Lead to oversee our service desk operations. The ideal candidate will possess extensive experience in service desk processes and procedures, a strong technical background in service desk work, and a proven track record of leadership in managing service desk teams. As the Service Desk Lead, you will be responsible for ensuring the efficient delivery of technical support services, optimizing service desk processes, and maintaining high levels of customer satisfaction. Responsibilities: Service Desk Operations Management: Develop, implement, and optimize service desk processes and procedures to ensure efficient incident resolution and service delivery. Monitor service desk performance metrics, including ticket volumes, response times, and resolution rates, and take corrective actions as needed to meet service level agreements (SLAs). Coordinate with other IT teams and stakeholders to escalate and resolve complex technical issues in a timely manner. Technical Expertise: Utilize your in-depth technical knowledge of service desk operations to provide guidance and support to service desk staff in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues. Stay updated on emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices in service desk management to drive continuous improvement initiatives. Serve as a subject matter expert on service desk-related technologies, tools, and processes. Team Leadership and Development: Lead, mentor, and motivate a team of service desk analysts, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning. Conduct regular performance evaluations, provide constructive feedback, and identify opportunities for skills development and career advancement. Promote teamwork and knowledge sharing among service desk staff to enhance overall team effectiveness and efficiency. Customer Satisfaction: Champion a customer-centric approach to service delivery, ensuring that all customer interactions are handled with professionalism, empathy, and efficiency. Monitor customer feedback and satisfaction surveys to identify areas for improvement and implement strategies to enhance the customer experience. Collaborate with other departments to proactively address customer needs and improve service quality. Job Specifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. Minimum of 8-12 years of overall IT experience Extensive knowledge of service desk processes, procedures, and best practices. Strong technical background in IT support, including experience in troubleshooting hardware, software, and network issues. Proven leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate a diverse team of professionals. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving abilities. ITIL or HDI certifications are highly desirable  Technical Expertise:   Experience in end to end Passive & Active network connectivity and high availability Administration of Server, Desktop, Think clients and other IT infrastructure systems Knowledge in AD security groups & Group policies Proficiency in Microsoft Office, MS Operating systems, Server / Desktop Virtualization for troubleshooting Experience in IT and OT network segregation and security standards Facilitate the IT Infrastructure to establish DES/ MES setup Data center BuildIT/OT Network and Infrastructure setup (Passive/ Active, NAC, AD, Firewall, etc.) Experience in Monitor and manage the network health and security of network communication Experience in NAC, Wireless controllers, Firewall implementation and configuration Networking & System Administration. Switches & Wireless Network Infrastructure. IP Surveillance Network and implementation of VMS viz. Milestone /Videonetics IP Telephony Network which includes installation & configuration Wired and Wireless network Infrastructure (Switching / Routing / WIFI) Mail exchange migrations and setup Configuring & Maintaining DNS and DHCP Administrating Proxy Server. Adding users and managing Cisco Wireless Controller and APs

column2: This position exists to ensure the appropriate and robust governance polices, processes and controls are developed, kept up to date and adhered to.    To oversee several key functions within the IT department that enable the delivery of a high -quality servic e to end users, and to ensure Service Support and Service Delivery processes are in place to meet business needs. This position is a stakeholder facing role and requires establishing and manage expectations within the business and drive the IT team to achi eve those expectations to a high standard.    2. ORGANISATIONAL CHART    3. PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES    Accountabilities Major Activities     Plan and manage the execution of IT procurement, disaster recovery drills and IT SLAs and services continuity      Ensure visibility, escalation, and management of IT risks inherent in the delivery of technology services.      Maintain and monitor key performance and key risk indicators and escalate breaches in triggers or limits      Ability to translate technical o r complex concepts into user -friendly language      Providing governance, risk, and compliance data insights to drive improvement across the IT system      Planning the implementation of processes and procedures for the identificat ion and assessment of risk in the organizations information system      Managing risks relating to information technology and cyber -security      Measuring and monitoring IT compliance      Developing systems and processes for the management and reporting of risks      Work in close partnership within all IT functions, other business functions & external partners for Services & Compliance. Head -Information TechnologySenior Manager -Information Technology 3      Ability to collaborate, working closely with both functional and technical teams      Ability to remain flexible as priorities change, adaptable to change, and able to accept ambiguity      A passion for Service Improvement & Experienced Service Management professional      Providing insights and recommendations on risk management to the executive team      Reviewing current and proposed information systems fo r compliance with the companys business strategy      Developing standard operating procedures for IT systems to ensure compliance with corporate governance      Design and implement the IT governance framework. Frameworks should, wherever possible, attempt to util ize industry standards and best practices such as COBIT. The framework should be regularly reviewed and updated as required.      Through analysis, advise on performance against established risk tolerance and performance objectives.      Ensure compliance. This is an ongoing governance responsibility. It aims to ensure that IT continually meets any regulatory, statutory, and legal obligations supports the organizations objectives while working within the defined ethical and cultural framework and follows the IT governance framework. Compliance also includes checking that the IT governance roles and responsibilities are still relevant.      Maintain high performing service support functions including and IT Service Desk, Desktop Support and VIP Support      Owner of the Incid ent, Request, Change and Escalation processes, ensuring high levels of performance in these processes, accurate reporting and establishing service improvement activities when required      As owner of the escalation process the Service Delivery Manager will ta ke ownership of major incidents to ensuring coordination of resolving parties, effective communication to stakeholders and post incident review      Monitor, control and support service delivery; ensuring systems, methodologies and procedures are in place and followed      Champion Service and Support in projects and developing a strong understanding of projects impacting your service area and ensuring service impact is minimized and agreed 4      Be accountable for the quality of Service and performance; ensuring future demand from growth and projects is understood and factored into capacity plans for all associated systems      Drive internal and third -party service review meetings covering performance, service improvements, quality and processes      Any other IT activities as demand arises      Lead and manage the establishment of a strategic, operational, and technical decision -making process required to ensure that IT services are aligned to the organizations priorities and risk appetite.    4. INTERACTIONS    Internal Clients    Roles you need to interact with inside the organization to enable success in your day-to-day work All Internal IT Functions & Departments    External Clients    Roles you need to interact with outside the organization to enable success in your day-to-day work CERT -In Application Support Partner FMS Partner All statutory bodies from time to time    5. SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE    Educational Qualifications        Minimum Qualification: Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or Electronic Engineering      COBIT & ITIL V4 Certified    Functional Skills    5      Enterprise IT Governance including knowledge of IT risk management and controls.      Working knowledge on ITSM tool      Develop and implement processes to assess and/or monitor the effectiveness of IT procedures to ensure adherence to standards and policies as appropriate      Strong analytical, problem -solving, and trouble -shooting skills      Effective commun ications skills including written, verbal, and presentation      Ability to work independently and within a team environment      Established skills in time management, multi -tasking, and prioritization of work      Previous experience as a Team Lead or demonstrable expe rience in leading virtual teams      Experience of managing 3rd parties and 3rd party delivered services      Service Management or Support in a large -scale and diverse environment of incident management, escalation procedures and related disciplines      Excellent leadership and people management skills      Willingness to support and mentor Service Desk Team      Able to wor k under pressure and meet deadlines      Able to demonstrate a high degree of flexibility including shift and out of hours working      Excellent organizational skills      Self-motivat ed and able to take responsibility      Able to manage and prioritize and tasks and tim e efficiently      Able to demonstrate initiative and a proactive approach to daily tasks    Relevant and total years of Experience        Minimum 7 years of experience as IT Service Desk Manager & 5 years on IT Governance

column2: Job description                          Join us as an Infrastructure Analyst          Hone your analytical skills as you provide support to ensure the operational health of the platform,  covering all aspects of service,  risk,  cost and people    You ll be supporting the platforms  operational stability and technology performance,  including maintaining any system s utilities and tools provided by the platform    This is an opportunity to learn a variety of new skills in a constantly evolving environment,  working closely with feature teams to continuously enhance your development    We're offering this role at associate level         What you'll do       As an Infrastructure Analyst,  you ll be providing input to and supporting the team s activities to make sure that the platform integrity is maintained in line with technical roadmaps,  while supporting change demands from domains or centres of excellence.  You ll be supporting the delivery of a robust production management service for relevant infrastructure platforms.         In addition,  you ll be contributing to the delivery of customer outcomes,  innovation and early learning by contributing to test products and services to identify early on if they are viable and deliver the desired outcomes.         Your role will involve:          Contributing to the platform risk culture,  making sure that risks are discussed and understood at every step,  and effectively collaborating to mitigate risk    Contributing to the planning and execution of work within the platform and the timely servicing of feature development requests from cross platform initiatives,  and supporting the delivery of regulatory reporting    Participating and seeking out opportunities to simplify the platform infrastructure,  architecture,  services and customer solutions,  guarding against introducing new complexity    Building relationships with platform,  domain and relevant cross-domain stakeholders    Making sure that controls are applied and constantly reviewed,  primarily against SOX,  to ensure full compliance to all our policies and regulatory obligations         The skills you'll need       To succeed in this role,  you ll need to be a very capable communicator with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly to colleagues,  including management level.  You ll need a solid background working in m  ainframe DB2 database administration in z/OS in a large database environment and e    xpertise in application database.              You'll also need experience in d    atabase design,  analysis,  logical or physical data modelling,  implementation,  data maintenance,  recovery solutions,  SQL performance tuning both static and dynamic sqls in DB2 z/OS.                We ll also look to you to demonstrate:          Technical knowledge,  including platform,  technology,  products and domains    Knowledge of relevant industry standard toolsets and processes to drive up customer service within an IT environment    An understanding of operational principles    Good collaboration and stakeholder management skills

We are looking for a well experienced resource who has excellent knowledge in administrating various SAP system landscapes such as S4 Hana, PI/PO, BI, BW, and Solution Manager Etc. The role will involve the management and administration of SAP landscape and technologies used by the Business units in News Corp by effectively collaborating with various vendors who supports the same. Maintain SAP performance by planning and executing SAP tuning strategies. Monitor all SAP systems (work processes, users, system logs, short dumps, locks, developer traces, system traces, disk space, etc.) proactively Perform SAP client administration (create client, copy client, delete client, export/import client) as required. Perform periodic SAP system refreshes of non-Production systems with Production data Work closely with Infrastructure team in planning and executing Infra upgrades and patching Participate in the planning and implementation of SAP system upgrades. Apply and migrate SAP maintenance (hot packages and kernel upgrades) through all systems using a structured methodology. Design and implement an optimal SAP configuration to maximize system performance and availability. Distribute the online SAP user workload and monitor and manage the SAP background job workload. Monthly production deployment of Business changes and fixes using Solution Manager Change Request Management Troubleshooting of the various SAP performance and configuration issues reported Coordinate with internal stakeholders, different teams and vendors as required for supporting the SAP landscapes Support annual disaster recovery testing Skill and Experience: Proven working and hands on experience with 5 or more years in SAP Basis administration of different SAP modules like S4 Hana, ERP, PI/PO, BI, BW, Solution Manager Deep level of knowledge on SAP basis components Previous experience in supporting finance systems like FICA, FICO, BPC, etc. Experience is SAP implementations Good experience in SAP upgrades, kernel patching, add-on installations Experience in configuring and working with Solution Manager 7.2 features such as ChaRM, Solution Documentation, Technical Monitoring etc. Experience in SAP system copies and refreshes Good Knowledge in configuring and managing archiving setup Experienced in supporting various connector & cloud integrations to third party systems like Concur Knowledge in cloud based SAP deployments like in AWS cloud Deep level of knowledge on HA/DR technologies including design and implementation of Geographically Dispersed HA/DR solutions Hana, Sybase Database administration knowledge Experience with deploying Single Sign On for various SAP components and integrations to third party using authentication services based on SAML2 Technical and configuration experience in business objects, Fiori etc. Good working knowledge on integration technologies like AIF and SAP Process Orchestration as well as connectivity protocols for sFTP, web services etc. Highly self-motivated, work ethic driven with keen attention to detail and exceptional customer orientation Strong analytical skills; ability to perform complex systems analysis and draw conclusions by relating information from different sources, including root-cause analysis and issue resolution Strong stakeholder management, communication and interpersonal skills SAP certification in basis administration is desirable. Have an insatiable thirst to be successful and motivation to make it all happen You are resourceful and like to research everything Have an insatiable thirst to be successful and motivation to make it all happen

column2: Job Description   PTM Manager  Proactive Task Maintenance Manager Department     Service Delivery Reports to     Director  Service Delivery / Service Delivery Manager Work Model      WFO Position Summary Managed Service Providers   (MSPs)  are always looking for skilled technicians who are responsible for handling back-end infrastructure support as well as advanced second-level support of service requests in a professional and timely manner and managing the activities and responsibilities of the service desk team. This relates to all technology, including workstations, servers, printers, networks, and vendor-specific hardware and software. PTM Manager  is a professional responsible for managing and overseeing the process of patch management within an organization. Patch management involves the identification, testing, deployment, and monitoring of software patches and updates to ensure that systems and applications are secure, up-to-date, and functioning properly. Education and Qualifications  >=5 years  of IT or Patching domain  Excellent written and verbal communication skills Excellent customer service skills Good conceptual understanding of Windows Patching architecture  Education: Graduate (Any stream) preferably in computer science or a related field Responsibilities 1.   Patch Management Strategy Develop and maintain a comprehensive patch management strategy, including policies and procedures. Keep up to date with industry best practices and emerging threats related to software vulnerabilities. 2.   Patch Identification and Assessment   Identify and evaluate software vulnerabilities and available patches. Prioritize patches based on criticality, impact, and risk.   3.   Testing and Validation  Establish a patch testing process to ensure that patches do not disrupt system functionality. Coordinate with system administrators and application owners for validation. 4.   Deployment and Distribution Plan and coordinate the deployment of patches across the organization's infrastructure. Automate patch distribution where possible to ensure timely updates . 5.   Change Management Coordinate with change management teams to ensure smooth patch deployment. Develop rollback plans in case of issues with patches. 6.   Documentation and Reporting Maintain accurate records of patching activities, including successful deployments, issues, and rollback actions. Generate regular reports to document patch compliance and vulnerabilities 7.   Security and Compliance Ensure that patching activities align with security policies and compliance requirements. Collaborate with security teams to address vulnerabilities. 8.   Incident Response Be prepared to respond to security incidents and vulnerabilities that require immediate patching. Develop and maintain an incident response plan related to patch management. 9.   Team Management Lead a team of patch management professionals, if applicable. Provide guidance and support to team members. 10.   Vendor and Software Management Maintain relationships with software vendors and stay informed about patch releases. Negotiate service level agreements (SLAs) with vendors related to patch availability and support.   Added Advantage     Desktop and Servers Networking Skills, Private cloud administration (VMware/Hyper V) Conceptual understanding or hands-on experience with Backups Conceptual understanding or hands-on experience with Firewalls MCSE or CCNA, Network+ or Security+ or VMware or Azure or ITIL foundation Our Culture and You What does the day in life look like for the PTM ??Manager?  You come to work each day in an environment that promotes a community of collaboration and engagement. You work closely with a passionate and positive leadership team that is invested in your success.  We work hard and have fun while dreaming big.   Our employees have indicated that with IT by Design, they will find a home where their passion and career goals finally intersect for them to live a life full of purpose.  Benefits Competitive salary and benefits Great work-life balance Comprehensive on-the-job training, best-in-industry communications training, and sponsorship for skill development. Medical insurance coverage worth INR 5 Lakh for employees and their immediate family. Accidental policy coverage to INR 5 Lakh ??erm Life insurance worth INR 20 Lakh Community-based engagement clubs at work, including book and movie clubs. Community Wellness programs for employees' wellbeing specially taken by CEO Life By Design which covers sessions. About Us When IT By Design launched in 2003, leadership imagined a company based on core values?? team that was more like family than employees and customers who grew to be close friends. The business has flourished following that blueprint.  ITBD has grown steadily by taking care of its team as if they were family, growing from 40 team members in 2013 to more than 500 today. The company remains privately held??nabling decision-making focused on what is best for partners and the ITBD community. As a people-centric business, ITBD is focused on creating a healthy, challenging, supportive community for its employees across three offices, which include the company headquarters in Jersey City, New Jersey; and locations in Chandigarh and Noida, India. The ITBD culture is based on five core values??umility, Accountability, Passion, Positivity, and Community??nd those principles guide our community and our engagement with customers. Ongoing career development opportunities and clear paths to success are also part of the ITBD's commitment to its employees??our success is our success. Both our India and Jersey City offices were recently certified as a Great Place to Work.  To continue to deliver exceptional customer services through our remote staffing, helpdesk, SOC, NOC, and consulting services, we expect to nearly double the size of our team while continuing to focus on building a community of caring, engaged, dedicated employees aligned with our core values

column2: Greetings! & very warm welcome to BEST-FIT Recruitment Riders, We are BEST-FIT Recruitment Riders feel immense pleasure to search and provide you with better carrier opportunities to aid you in achieving your aspirations. BEST-FIT Recruitment Rider is a  highly specialized Recruitment & Executive Search Partner for Pharmaceutical, Biotech, CRO, Chemicals, Medical Devices & Turnkey Pharma Projects Engineering-Construction Design Sectors.   We are searching & recruiting highly qualified professionals for Middle-Senior-Upper-Management and Executive jobs.  (Eg: Managers, VP, President, CFO & CEO).   Also offering customized recruitment services by Headhunting & Executive Search for Middle & Top management level professionals according to clients specific needs. We are BEST-FIT Recruitment Riders do exactly what our name tells.  To know more about us please visit our website: www.bestfitrecruitment.co.in We would like to inform you that presently we have  professional career opportunity  matching to your profile with one of our esteemed client. Please see the following position summary: Client: MNC Global Leader Specialty Chemicals  Position: Analyst / Specialist - ITSM Operation (Global Role)  Job Location: Mumbai  Reporting to: Manager - ITSM Operation  Role & responsibilities     As IT Service Management (ITSM) Operation Analyst your will be responsible for the daily oversight of the global ITSM process framework.  Enforcing, monitoring, measuring and continually improving 1 or more process areas.  Engaging with internal teams and service provider teams to ensure that IT staff and ITSM tool sets are equipped for efficient and effective execution of assigned ITIL processes.  Reporting to the Manager of ITSM Operations, this position serves as part of an ITSM team that works in close partnership with IT Demand & Operations staff to drive operational excellence and continual improvement. Serve as the point of contact for the ITSM processes during the service operation supporting the Incident, Major Incident, Request Fulfilment, Change, Problem and Release Management processes globally. Ensure efficient and effective integration between service areas during the execution of the ITSM processes.  Implement the required actions for ongoing maturation of ITSM tool to ensure maximum effectiveness with respect to process execution and reporting capabilities. In partnership with Business Partners & Service Managers, ensure support teams are operating in adherence with all ITSM Processes and with associated contractual Service Level Agreements. Regularly review and update of the operational procedures ensuring all revisions are appropriately deployed, to all impacted parties and stakeholders. Identify trends and gaps on the operational execution to raise continual improvement initiatives relative to Incident Management, Request Fulfillment and Change Management. Evaluate Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) Survey results in order to identify and drive improvements to the end user experience. Participate in the ITSM governance projects and related initiatives with the supervision of the ITSM Operation Manager.  Preferred candidate profile     BA / BS degree from an accredited school preferred.  Degree may be substituted with additional equivalent years of direct experience in the ITSM field. Experience working in an ITSM role, preferably with direct responsibility for service operation and continual improvement. Experience in administration of ITSM tools, systems integrations (scripting, APIs) and automation tools. Working knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL) and Database administration. Expertise on operational and end-user procedures documentation (Lean IT, Six sigma, UML.).  Exceptional interpersonal skills  servant leadership, collaboration, facilitation, and negotiation. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to effectively communicate technical actions to a non-technical audience. Customer service oriented. Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel and MS Power BI. Energetic and have an excellent work ethic. Desire and ability to quickly learn and apply new concepts. Focus on customer experience, operational stability, and major incident reduction. Ability to work with all levels of management in a large and matrixed corporate environment.  Perks and benefits

column2: Anzen Technologies Pvt. Ltd.   is a leading cyber-security service provider that empowers organizations across several industries with state-of-the-art security services, cutting-edge solutions, and unprecedented expertise in Cyber Security, IT Governance, Risk Management, and Compliance. As your trusted partner, we provide a comprehensive suite of   End-to-End security   services and consultancy, that is customized to guard your critical infrastructure and elevate the security standards in BFSI, eCommerce, IT/ITES, Pharmaceuticals, and other sectors. Job Description    1. Develop and implement comprehensive IT infrastructure security strategies, policies, and procedures to safeguard company assets and data. 2. Design, deploy, and manage security solutions, including firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, endpoint security, identity and access management, and encryption technologies, NAC, PIM/PAM, DLP, etc.  3. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate security controls into IT systems and applications throughout the development lifecycle. 5. column2: The Role As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer with a focus on Security at HashiCorp, you will spearhead initiatives to ensure our infrastructure and cloud products adhere to the highest standards of security, compliance, and governance. With over 6 years of experience in site reliability engineering or a related field, you will play a critical role in integrating security practices into our operational processes, enhancing our overall security posture. Key Responsibilities Security and Compliance: Lead efforts to maintain and enhance security compliance across all cloud services, ensuring adherence to industry standards and regulatory requirements. Infrastructure Security: Implement and manage security tools and practices, including automated compliance checks, to safeguard our infrastructure and applications. Incident Response: Coordinate with the security team to respond to and remediate security incidents promptly, minimizing impact and ensuring continuous service availability. Governance and Policy: Develop and enforce policies related to licensing, compliance, and governance, working closely with legal and compliance teams to navigate complex regulatory landscapes. Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with engineering, operations, and product teams to embed security considerations in the development and deployment lifecycle. Monitoring and Reporting: Establish comprehensive monitoring for security metrics, reporting on compliance status, and identifying areas for improvement. Ideal Candidate 6+ years of experience in site reliability engineering, security engineering, or a closely related field, with a strong focus on security practices. Expertise in security compliance frameworks (e.g., SOC 2, GDPR, HIPAA) and cloud security best practices in AWS, Azure, GCP, or similar platforms. Familiarity with infrastructure as code (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation) and automation tools for security compliance checks. Strong analytical skills, capable of identifying and mitigating security risks before they impact operations. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex security concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders. Experience with incident response and security operations in a cloud-based environment. #LI-hybrid

column2: About The Role:  As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer focusing on Infrastructure at HashiCorp, you will be central to our mission of maintaining and enhancing the backbone of our cloud infrastructure. With over 6 years of experience in site reliability engineering or a related field, you will leverage your deep understanding of DNS, CDN, Artifactory, base images, and HashiStack to ensure our infrastructure is not only robust and scalable but also optimized for performance and cost. Key Responsibilities Infrastructure Optimization: Develop and implement strategies to enhance the performance, scalability, and reliability of HashiCorp's infrastructure, focusing on DNS, CDN, Artifactory, base images, and the HashiStack. Automation and Tooling: Design and refine tools and processes for automating infrastructure deployment and management, increasing efficiency and reducing manual overhead. Monitoring and Incident Response: Implement comprehensive monitoring solutions to proactively identify and address issues. Lead the response to infrastructure incidents, minimizing impact on service availability and performance. Collaboration and Planning: Work closely with engineering and product teams to align infrastructure development with company objectives. Contribute to infrastructure planning, capacity management, and architectural improvements. Knowledge Sharing: Serve as a subject matter expert in infrastructure technologies and practices. Mentor junior team members and share insights with the broader engineering team to foster a culture of learning and improvement. Ideal Candidate 6+ years of experience in site reliability engineering, infrastructure engineering, or a closely related field, with a proven track record of managing large-scale, cloud-based infrastructure. Deep technical expertise in managing and optimizing DNS, CDN, Artifactory, and cloud infrastructure services, with hands-on experience with HashiCorp tools (Terraform, Vault, Consul, Nomad) preferred. Strong background in infrastructure as code, automation tooling, and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP). Excellent problem-solving abilities, with the capacity to lead incident response efforts and drive root cause analysis and resolution. Effective communication skills, capable of collaborating with cross-functional teams and articulating technical concepts to a non-technical audience. A commitment to continuous learning and improvement, staying abreast of the latest industry trends and technologies. #LI-hybrid

column1: Lead Site Reliability Engineer - Cost Optimization (FinOps)
column2: Our Team The HashiCorp FinOps Engineering team is responsible for driving and improving HashiCorps internal FinOps capabilities and culture. Our focus is on empowering cost-conscious decision-making by enabling HashiCorp engineers to understand the cost efficiency of their systems through the democratization and attribution of cost and usage data. We seek to measure cultural progress by identifying a set of KPIs and foster continuous improvement through training, cross-functional collaboration, and gamification. This team will involve a mixture of software engineering, and cloud infrastructure engineering experience with a focus on both building tooling and cloud optimization expertise. The team will build strong cross-functional partnerships across finance, product, and engineering to deliver meaningful outcomes. About this Role This engineering role is on a nascent, growing engineering team. The team is responsible for products that touch many areas of engineering organizations at HashiCorp, so applicants will need to excel at collaboration, have product-focused mindsets, and be comfortable iterating in an agile manner toward solutions. In this role, you can expect to: Be responsible for and drive internal FinOps capabilities and culture. Enable cost-conscious engineering decisions through democratization and attribution of cost and usage data. Deliver elegant, user-focused solutions that improve our FinOps capabilities and foster FinOps engineering culture. Tactically drive and advocate for infrastructure efficiency improvements. Build technical skills and relationships within a team of engineers and SREs. Learn, teach, and collaborate cross-functionally. You may be a good fit for our team if: Professional backend software development experience in cloud environments Interested or experienced in FinOps practices and capabilities. Enjoy working on a variety of scopes spanning software engineering, cloud infrastructure, and SRE. Worked to drive efficiency improvements of software at scale. Experience collaborating cross-functionally to deliver engineering culture change. Worked on infrastructure teams in customer-centric and agile organizations with empathy and compassion Worked with SaaS or another type of managed software offering Expertise in one or more of the major public clouds  #LI-Hybrid #LI-SG1

column2: The Cherwell Administrator with minimum 5 years of experience is responsible for the administration, configuration, and maintenance of IT Service Management (ITSM) tool. Ensure the smooth operation of ITSM processes and workflows, support end-users, and drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance service delivery and efficiency.   Responsibilities.  1. Administer and maintain ITSM tool i.e. Cherwell  2. Configure and customize ITSM workflows, forms, fields, and notifications to align with organizational requirements.   3. Manage user access permissions, roles, and groups within the ITSM tool, ensuring appropriate access levels and security.   4. Provide technical support to end-users, troubleshoot issues, and resolve tickets related to Cherwell tool functionality.  5. Collaborate with stakeholders to define and document ITSM processes, policies, and procedures.   6. Perform regular audits and health checks of ITSM configurations and data to ensure accuracy and compliance.  7. Monitor system performance and utilization, identify bottlenecks, and implement optimizations to improve efficiency  8. Coordinate software updates, patches, and upgrades for Cherwell, following change management processes.   9. Develop and maintain integrations between Cherwell and other systems or applications.     Qualifications:  1. Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field, or equivalent work experience.   2. Proven experience as an ITSM Administrator, with hands-on experience administering Cherwell.   3. Strong technical proficiency in Cherwell administration, configuration, and customization.   4. Familiarity with ITSM processes such as incident management, change management, problem management, and service level management.   5. Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot technical issues independently.   6. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels.   7. Knowledge of ITIL or other IT service management frameworks is a plus.   8. Experience with scripting languages (e.g., JavaScript, PowerShell) for automation and customization is desirable.   9. Certification in ITIL Foundation or relevant ITSM certifications is preferred.   10. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and prioritize tasks effectively.
