column1: Principal Solution Architect - AWS Cloud Migrations
column2: Job Title : Principal Solution Architect - AWS Cloud Migrations Experience:  12+ Years (Minimum 4 years relevant experience) Location:  Noida (Preferred) /Mumbai Job Description Join our global AWS Center of Excellence (CoE) as a Principal Solution Architect, leading cloud migration initiatives for clients worldwide. Leverage your expertise to design and implement tailored solutions, collaborate with regional teams, and drive technical conversations with clients, shaping the future of digital transformation. Key Responsibilities Collaborate with clients globally as part of the AWS      Center of Excellence (CoE) to understand their business objectives,      technical requirements, and existing infrastructure for successful      migration to AWS cloud. Lead and conduct comprehensive cloud migration      assessments utilizing AWS methodologies and best practices to evaluate      workloads, applications, and infrastructure readiness for migration. Design end-to-end cloud migration solutions tailored to      diverse client needs across different regions, considering scalability,      security, and performance, in alignment with global AWS CoE standards. Leverage expertise in AWS migration assessment      frameworks such as AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF) and AWS Migration      Readiness Assessment (MRA) to evaluate technical feasibility, risks, and      opportunities for migration. Utilize knowledge of AWS migration tools and services      to automate assessment processes and generate actionable insights for      clients, adhering to global AWS CoE guidelines. Collaborate with cross-functional teams within the      global AWS CoE and GDC to develop migration strategies based on assessment      findings, considering factors such as cost optimization, compliance, and      performance. Provide technical leadership and guidance throughout      the migration lifecycle for global projects, from assessment and planning      to execution and optimization, while adhering to global AWS CoE standards      and best practices. Work closely with regional teams to provide technical      enablement, support, and mentorship, assisting them in conducting      effective tech conversations with clients and ensuring alignment with      global AWS CoE initiatives. Support regional teams in addressing technical      challenges, providing expertise, and facilitating knowledge sharing to      enhance their capabilities in delivering AWS cloud solutions. Stay updated on AWS services, best practices, and      industry trends applicable to diverse regions to provide guidance and      support to regional teams within the global AWS CoE network. Qualification Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or      related field; Master's degree preferred. Extensive experience in designing and implementing      cloud solutions, with a focus on AWS services. Proven track record of leading successful cloud      migration projects on a global scale, including re-platforming,      re-hosting, and refactoring strategies. Strong knowledge and experience in conducting cloud      migration assessments using AWS methodologies and frameworks such as AWS      Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF) and AWS Migration Readiness Assessment      (MRA), in alignment with global AWS best practices. In-depth understanding of AWS migration tools and      services for assessment automation and insights generation, adhering to      AWS best practices. Strong communication skills with the ability to      articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical      stakeholders across different regions and within the global AWS CoE &      GDC. Experience in providing technical enablement and      support to regional teams, facilitating tech conversations with clients,      and driving alignment with global CoE initiatives. AWS certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions      Architect - Pro, AWS Certified DevOps Engineer) preferred.
column11: Aws Migration, Cloud Migration, Migration Readiness Assessment, Migration, Cloud Adoption Framework, implementation, Cloud Architecture, AWS

column2: Job Summary : The Helpdesk Manager will oversee the helpdesk operations and ensure that IT support services are delivered effectively and efficiently to meet the needs of the organization. This role involves managing a team of helpdesk technicians, developing procedures, and implementing best practices to enhance the IT service delivery process. Key Responsibilities : 1. Team Leadership and Management:   - Lead, mentor, and manage a team of helpdesk technicians.   - Develop and conduct training programs to improve team skills and performance.   - Conduct regular performance reviews and provide feedback to team members. 2.  Service Desk Operations:   - Oversee the day-to-day operations of the helpdesk, ensuring timely and effective resolution of user issues.   - Monitor helpdesk performance metrics and report on key performance indicators (KPIs).   - Develop and implement helpdesk policies, procedures, and service level agreements (SLAs). 3.  Incident and Problem Management :   - Manage and prioritize helpdesk tickets, ensuring all incidents and requests are resolved within agreed timelines.   - Conduct root cause analysis for recurring issues and implement solutions to prevent future occurrences.   - Coordinate with other IT teams to resolve complex technical issues. 4.  Customer Service :   - Ensure a high level of customer satisfaction by delivering quality support services.   - Handle escalated issues and complaints, providing timely and effective resolutions.   - Maintain regular communication with users to provide updates on their requests and incidents. 5.  Reporting and Documentation :   - Generate and analyze regular reports on helpdesk activities, performance metrics, and user satisfaction.   - Use data insights to identify trends, areas for improvement, and training requirements.   - Present detailed reports and actionable recommendations to senior management.  - Prepare and present regular reports on helpdesk performance, including ticket resolution times, user satisfaction, and other KPIs.   - Maintain accurate documentation of helpdesk procedures, policies, and technical solutions. 6. Licensing Management :   - Oversee the management of software and hardware licenses, ensuring compliance with licensing agreements.   - Maintain an accurate inventory of all licensed products, tracking renewals and expirations.   - Collaborate with the procurement team to acquire new licenses and manage renewals efficiently. 7.   Vendor Liaison :   - Establish and maintain strong relationships with external vendors and service providers.   - Negotiate contracts and service agreements to secure favorable terms and conditions.   - Coordinate with vendors for technical support and escalate issues when necessary. 8. Continuous Improvement :   - Stay updated with the latest industry trends, technologies, and best practices in IT support.   - Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement changes to enhance service delivery.   - Foster a culture of continuous learning and development within the helpdesk team. 9.  Budget and Resource Management:   - Assist in the preparation and management of the helpdesk budget.   - Ensure appropriate resource allocation to meet helpdesk demands. Qualifications : - Education: Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field. - Experience:  - Minimum of 7 years of experience in IT support or helpdesk roles.  - At least 2 years of experience in a supervisory or managerial role. -Certifications:  - ITIL Foundation Certification (preferred).  - Other relevant certifications (e.g., CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certified: Modern Desktop Administrator) are a plus. Skills and Competencies : - Strong leadership and team management skills. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. - In-depth knowledge of helpdesk and IT service management principles. - Proficiency in using helpdesk software and tools (e.g., ServiceNow, Zendesk, Jira Service Desk). - Strong problem-solving and analytical skills. - Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively. - Customer-focused attitude with a commitment to providing high-quality service. - Knowledge of IT infrastructure, including networks, hardware, and software. Working Conditions : - Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.

column2: Job Description:  We are seeking an 8-10  yrs experienced Cybersecurity Engineer with specialized expertise in AWS cloud services to strengthen our cybersecurity framework and protect our digital assets. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of AWS security services and best practices, with a proven track record of implementing robust security measures in a cloud environment. This role involves conducting security assessments, managing cloud-based security tools, and working closely with IT and development teams to ensure our AWS infrastructure is secure against threats.     Responsibilities: Design and implement security architectures for AWS cloud environments, ensuring best practices are followed for a secure infrastructure. Utilize AWS security services such as AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM), AWS Key Management Service (KMS), AWS Shield, AWS WAF, and AWS Guard Duty to enhance security measures. Conduct regular security assessments and audits to identify vulnerabilities within the AWS cloud environment and recommend mitigating strategies. Develop and enforce cloud security policies and procedures in line with industry standards and compliance requirements (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA). Collaborate with IT and development teams to integrate security practices into the development lifecycle and cloud deployment processes. Manage incident response and investigation activities related to security breaches within the AWS environment. Stay up-to-date with the latest security threats, trends, and technologies, and implement continuous improvements to the security posture. Provide training and guidance to other team members on cloud security best practices and awareness. Requirements: Professional certifications in cybersecurity and AWS (e.g., CISSP, AWS Certified Security - Specialty) are highly desirable. In-depth knowledge of AWS architecture, security services, and best practices. Experience with implementing and managing security tools and services within AWS, including IAM, KMS, Shield, WAF, and GuardDuty. Strong understanding of network security, encryption, and vulnerability management. Familiarity with compliance and regulatory frameworks relevant to cloud security. Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and mitigate security risks effectively. In-depth understanding of network protocols, firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS), and system administration principles. Familiarity with various operating systems (Windows, Linux, macOS) and their security configurations. Proficiency in using security tools for vulnerability scanning, penetration testing, incident response, and forensic analysis. Experience with SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) and SOAR (Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response) platforms is a plus. Knowledge of cloud security concepts and best practices for securing cloud environments, including AWS, Azure, or GCP.  Secure architecture (together with systems and network administration).  Secure architecture Ability to understand and analyze threat intelligence feeds, identify emerging threats, and assess potential risks. Understanding of digital forensics principles and methodologies for collecting, preserving, and analyzing digital evidence in the case of a security incident. Can identify, assess, prioritise and mitigate vulnerabilities. Knowledge of mobile device security best practices and tools for securing smartphones, tablets, and other mobile devices. Experience with penetration testing methodologies and tools for identifying security vulnerabilities in applications and infrastructure.

column2: Job Description:  We are on the hunt for a skilled 8-10 yrs exp DevSecOps Engineer to secure and manage our web applications, which leverage Angular for the front-end and Spring Boot for backend services, across MySQL, Oracle, and MSSQL databases within the AWS cloud environment. This role demands a deep understanding of AWS services, including ECS, CI/CD, SNS, and IAM, alongside expertise in firewall security configurations, and KeyCloak for identity and access management. The successful candidate will be instrumental in embedding security practices into our development lifecycle, automating deployments, and maintaining the integrity of our cloud infrastructure to support all initiatives.   Responsibilities: Design, implement, and manage CI/CD pipelines using AWS CI/CD services for deploying Angular front-end and Spring Boot backend services. Administer AWS ECS for container management and orchestration to ensure scalable and efficient application deployment. Utilize AWS SNS for managing and dispatching system-wide notifications for operational events and security alerts. Enhance security posture by configuring firewalls, managing AWS Security services, and ensuring compliance with security best practices. Implement and manage AWS IAM roles and policies for secure access control across AWS services. Integrate KeyCloak for identity and access management, ensuring secure authentication and authorization processes for applications. Collaborate with development teams to incorporate security assessments and tools into the development process, identifying vulnerabilities early. Automate infrastructure provisioning and management using infrastructure as code (IaC) tools, such as AWS CloudFormation or Terraform. Monitor, analyze, and optimize performance across all platforms and services, addressing any issues to maintain high availability and reliability. Stay abreast of the latest security threats and technologies, continuously improving our security measures and cloud infrastructure. Requirements: At least 3 years of experience in DevSecOps, with a comprehensive understanding of AWS cloud services (ECS, CI/CD, SNS, Security, IAM). Expertise in deploying and managing applications using Angular and Spring Boot. Proficient in database management for MySQL, Oracle, and MSSQL, with a focus on security and performance. Solid experience with AWS ECS for container orchestration, AWS CI/CD pipelines, and AWS SNS for notifications. Knowledge of firewall security configurations, AWS security practices, and IAM policies. Experience with KeyCloak for secure identity and access management. Familiarity with Docker, Kubernetes, AWS CloudFormation, and Terraform for infrastructure management. Strong problem-solving skills, ability to work under pressure, and effective communication abilities/ In-depth understanding of integrating security best practices throughout the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), including threat modelling, secure coding practices, CI/CD security testing, and infrastructure security configuration. Proficiency in scripting languages like Python, Bash, or PowerShell for automating security tasks and integrating security tools within the CI/CD pipeline. Strong understanding of cloud security concepts and best practices for securing cloud environments (AWS, Azure, or GCP), including access control, encryption, and vulnerability management. Knowledge of DevSecOps methodologies (e.g., Shift Left Security) and experience using relevant tools like vulnerability scanners, security orchestration, and capable of doing manual code review. Knowledge of API security principles and best practices for securing APIs and mitigating related vulnerabilities. Experience with penetration testing methodologies and tools for identifying security vulnerabilities in applications and infrastructure.
column11: Devsecops, Aws Security, ECS, Cicd Pipeline

column2: The Manager - IT Infrastructure is responsible for overseeing and managing the organization's information technology infrastructure, ensuring its stability, reliability, and security      This role involves leading a team of IT professionals and collaborating with other departments to ensure the effective operation of all IT systems, networks, and infrastructure components        Key Responsibilities:        Strategy and Planning:Develop and implement strategic plans for the organization's IT infrastructure to meet current and future business needs      Evaluate and recommend new technologies, tools, and systems to enhance the IT infrastructure and optimize operations      Collaborate with senior management and stakeholders to align IT infrastructure initiatives with organizational goals      Infrastructure Management:Manage the day-to-day operations of the IT infrastructure, including servers, networks, storage systems, and data centers      Ensure high availability, reliability, and performance of infrastructure components through proactive monitoring, maintenance, and capacity planning      Implement and maintain security measures to protect the organization's IT infrastructure and data from unauthorized access or breaches      Team Leadership and Development:Lead and manage a team of IT professionals, including hiring, training, mentoring, and performance evaluation      Foster a collaborative and high-performing work environment, promoting teamwork and knowledge sharing      Provide guidance and support to the team in troubleshooting complex infrastructure issues and implementing solutions      Vendor Management:Evaluate and select external vendors and service providers for IT infrastructure projects or ongoing support      Negotiate contracts, service level agreements (SLAs), and pricing terms with vendors      Monitor vendor performance and ensure compliance with agreed-upon service levels and contractual obligations      Incident and Problem Management:Respond to and resolve escalated infrastructure-related incidents and problems in a timely manner      Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective actions to prevent future incidents      Develop and maintain documentation, including standard operating procedures (SOPs) and knowledge base articles      IT Governance and Compliance:Ensure compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards related to IT infrastructure      Establish and enforce IT policies, procedures, and best practices      Conduct regular audits and risk assessments to identify potential vulnerabilities and implement appropriate controls      Budgeting and Cost Management:Develop and manage the IT infrastructure budget, including forecasting and cost optimization initiatives      Monitor expenditures, track financial performance, and report on budget variances      Identify opportunities for cost savings and recommend strategies to optimize IT infrastructure investments      Qualifications and Skills:Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field (Master's degree preferred)      Proven experience in You are overly responsible for Ticket Escalation i.e. what gets escalated to who, and why.         You will be expected to find areas of innovation to drive improvement for your teams and the wider business. column2: Roles and Responsibilities Set your sights on a role making a real difference in the healthcare system. Were looking for a self-motivated Service Transition Coordinator professional to join our team. The Service Transition position will involve Change and Release Management responsibilities.  We have a relentless focus on driving results for our customers and enabling them to invest more into patient care; in turn, this allows us to continue to grow our company and your career.   This person will have the ability to understand and implement ITSM Service Transition strategies for Change and Release Management.  Service Transition Coordinator should look for ways to streamline and improve the Service Transition processes and SDLC interrelated processes.   This position will take part in other ITSM processes, or as required perform as a back up to maintain operational activities within the Service Transition team.  General Skill Set:   Technical Graduate (B.Tech/BE/MCA/BCA/MSc/BSc-Computer Science) or equivalent academic qualification.  2-4 years of previous Change & Release Management (ITIL) experience  2-4 years of experience in information systems operations environment in systems analysis or development  Knowledge of software development lifecycle (SDLC)  Written and verbal communication skills are a must  General PC knowledge including Microsoft Office (Excel and Word),  Demonstrated effective experience in working with Agile and Scrum teams  Demonstrated effective oral and written communication skills  Demonstrated ability to coordinate cross-functional work teams toward task completion  Demonstrated effective analytical skills  Demonstrated active listening skills  Energetic and proactive with a "can-do" attitude  Flexible and adaptable; able to work in ambiguous situations  Must be a team player and able to work collaboratively with and through others  Experience of ITSM tool sets preferably Service Now  Certification in ITIL Foundations v4  Experience with Project Management practices  Your day to day activity will include for Change & Release Management coordinator:   Change:   Effectively manage the end to end change lifecycle and identify process improvements where possible.  Conduct impact analyses, assess change readiness and identify key stakeholders  Day to day management of change requests  Identification and allocation of relevant change approvals  Support change management at the organizational level  Support the design, development, delivery and management of communications  Conducting & verifying post implementation reviews, investigating issues arising out of change implementation  Responsible to review Change Schedule (CS) for conflicts  Responsible for education of the Change Management process  Drive continuous improvements to the quality and efficiency of the change management process  Responsible for drafting of business wide communications for outages  Involved in the implementation of the Asset Management process and recording of modifications in relationship to changes  Report Change Management activities to all levels of management.  Release:  Communicate all key project plans, commitments, and changes including requirements, QA plans, schedule, and scope changes  Manage relationships and coordinate work between different teams at different locations  Conduct Release Readiness reviews, Milestone Reviews, and Business Go/No-Go reviews  Produce and/or review Deployment and Implementation Plans  Weekly Release Reporting  Communicate release details and schedules to the Business as required  Negotiate, plan and manage all release activities  Work with release engineers to understand impacts of branches and code merges  Maintains the release schedule for all core services and ensure alignment across key partners and vendors.  Continually work towards making improvements in the release process  Lead and co-ordinate the Go-Live activities including the execution of the deployment Plans and checklists.  Participate in Change meetings to discuss release scope and/or roadblocks  Maintains a release repository and manages key information such as build and release procedures, dependencies, and notification lists
column11: Change Management, ITIL, Release Management

column2: Position : Head of Solution Architect Experience- 15+ years Location: Noida  Description We're on the hunt for a passionate and technically adept cloud champion to lead our Cloud Professional Services team.This role demands a hands-on leader who thrives in the trenches alongside their team while possessing the strategic vision to guide successful client engagements. You'll be responsible for architecting, implementing, and optimizing innovative cloud solutions for clients, fostering a high-performing team environment, and building strong, trusting client relationships. Responsibilities Lead and participate in      the design, development, and delivery of robust cloud solutions      for clients, leveraging your expertise in AWS Cloud Services      (infrastructure & DevOps). Provide technical      leadership and guidance to the Cloud Professional Services      team, ensuring best practices in      infrastructure, network, security, and DevOps      methodologies. Own and manage complex      cloud projects from pre-sales to implementation and ongoing      support, ensuring on-time and on-budget completion. Collaborate with      architects, engineers, and consultants to develop and implement      best practices across AWS Cloud Services, infrastructure automation      tools, and DevOps pipelines. Cultivate strong      relationships with clients, acting as a trusted advisor and technical      expert who understands their unique business needs. Partner with sales and      marketing teams to identify new business opportunities and drive cloud      adoption,showcasing the power of innovative cloud solutions. Stay up-to-date on the      latest cloud technologies and industry trends (AWS certifications a      plus!), ensuring our service offerings are cutting-edge. Manage and mentor the      Cloud Professional Services team, fostering a culture of      collaboration, continuous learning,and knowledge sharing. Qualifications 15+ years of experience      in IT services, with a strong focus on Cloud      technologies, particularly AWS Cloud Services (infrastructure &      DevOps). Proven track record of      successfully designing, implementing, and optimizing complex      cloud projects, with a hands-on technical skillset. Demonstrated leadership      qualities, ability to motivate and inspire a team, delegate      effectively, and lead by example. In-depth understanding      of cloud architecture, design, implementation, security      best practices, and infrastructure automation tools. Strong      experience with industry-standard DevOps methodologies is a plus. Excellent      communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills with the      ability to effectively bridge the gap between technical and non-technical      audiences. Ability to build trust      and manage relationships effectively with clients and internal      stakeholders. Strong analytical and      problem-solving skills with a focus on achieving client satisfaction. Confidence and maturity      to handle challenging situations, think critically, and navigate      complex technical environments.

column2: Department   Overview The IT department at TresVista is a critical function in running the business successfully. It is responsible for managing and maintaining the company's technology infrastructure and systems, including hardware, software, and networks. The IT department  also works to ensure that technology is used effectively and efficiently to support the organization's operations and goals.  Key Role Deliverables   Leading the IT Operations team at TresVista   Developing and implementing IT strategies and plans that support the company's goals and objectives   Managing the IT department, including staffing, budgeting, and resource allocation  Ensuring uninterrupted day-to-day functions including but not limited to Helpdesk, Network, Server Infrastructure, Access  Requests, etc. software initiatives  Ensuring the security and integrity of the company's data and systems   Building out IT Infrastructure (including conference system, telephones, Wi-Fi, storage, mobility) following areas: applications, network/ systems, database, and web development   Optimizing and managing the internal ERP and CRM system which contributes to delivery of value to business aligned with best  practices and standards- Software line   Developing and maintaining overall framework of IT policies, standards, and strategies that will empower business and people to  deliver on their commitments to the strategy and budgets   Ensuring that there is no failure in business operations and appropriate disaster recovery plans are in place and regularly tested  for readiness for unforeseen and unexpected events which can impact the business continuity    Having pivotal role in supporting the business departments and meeting their needs in a time-bound manner    Identifying security threats, formulating strategies and methods to mitigating the threats    Developing long-term plans to sustain and support the business, anticipating the future trends   Providing leadership initiatives in building in-house ERP systems   Leading strategic insight and overview of business case justifications and ROI analysis for IT spending and initiatives  Prerequisites   Ability to act as a high-level subject manager expert and drive strategic direction. column2: Greeting from FIS!!   As the world works and lives faster, FIS is leading the way. Our fintech solutions touch nearly every market, company and person on the planet. Our teams are inclusive and diverse. Our colleagues work together and celebrate together. If you want to advance the world of fintech, wed like to ask you: Are you FIS? About the role As a Product Support Representative, you will work with FIS clients to provide in-depth product support. You will take incoming inquiries to resolve customer concerns raised during installation, operation, maintenance or product application. About the team FIS Securities Finance Suite provides a holistic set of products and services that addresses the needs of the financing market. Our products levels the siloes and eliminates redundant, inefficient processes so you can maximize top line returns. With a global platform and a real-time view, you can efficiently utilize and optimize inventory across the firm to monetize your assets, make more informed trading decisions and manage collateral more effectively helping clients guard against regulatory risk by eliminating manual processes and errors through increased automation and connectivity. This team is a collection of highly specialized, self-motivated and collaborative professionals spanning a range of functional & technical disciplines: software development, data researchers, market & application specialists and product support & management. What you will be doing Provide in-depth product support to FIS clients by resolving incoming inquiries Troubleshoot problems with malfunctioning software applications and recommends corrective action Respond to customer product inquiries via telephone or in written internet-based email or chat sessions Document customer information and recurring technical issues to support product quality programs and product development Recreate and resolve client issues in test environment, identifies/documents how applications and systems interact to support business processes Works closely with Developers, Business Analysts and other Subject Matter Experts to triage and resolve functional and technical issues. What you bring Bachelor?? degree in computer science or information systems or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work Experience. 5+ years of relevant experience in application support Knowledge of and strong interest in financial markets (Securities Finance) is a plus Knowledge in any of the following: programming, business analysis or implementation of software products a plus High level understanding of programming languages prefer .net core,HTML High level of operating systems knowledge (prefer 3+ years in Windows,Linux) Understanding of MQ, SFTP, File uploads, Azure technology Understanding of Azure Cosmos DB Self-starter who is able to work individually with minimum guidance in challenging environments. Excellence in managing customer relationships Excellent written, verbal, and inter-personal communication skills Analytical and problem-solving skills Organizational and time management skills required Team player and willing to progress in a rapidly changing environment What we offer you: At FIS, you can learn, grow and make an impact in your career. Our benefits include: Competitive salary and attractive benefits A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities A modern, international work environment and a dedicated and motivated team Diverse and collaborative atmosphere Professional and personal development resources Opportunities to volunteer and support charities

column2: Job Summary: The AWS L1 Support Engineer plays a crucial role in providing technical support and assistance to customers utilizing Amazon Web Services (AWS) platforms. This position requires a deep understanding of AWS services, infrastructure, and best practices, along with excellent communication skills to effectively troubleshoot and resolve customer issues. Key Responsibilities: 1. Provide technical support to customers via email, phone, or ticketing system regarding AWS services and products. 2. Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to AWS infrastructure, networking, security, and application deployment. 3. Collaborate with other team members and cross-functional teams to escalate and resolve complex customer issues on time. 4. Document troubleshooting steps, resolutions, and best practices for knowledge sharing and internal training purposes. 5. Stay updated on AWS services, features, and best practices to provide proactive support and guidance to customers. 6. Participate in on-call rotation schedules to provide 24/7 support coverage for critical incidents and escalations. 7. Work closely with AWS technical account managers and solution architects to address customer needs and optimize AWS environments. 8. Identify opportunities for automation and improvement in support processes to enhance efficiency and customer satisfaction. Requirements: 1. bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or related field. 2. Minimum of 1 or 2 years of experience in technical support roles, preferably with a focus on cloud computing and AWS services. 3. Strong understanding of AWS services such as EC2, S3, RDS, VPC, IAM, CloudFormation, etc. 4. Hands-on experience with Linux/Unix operating systems and scripting languages like Python, Shell, or PowerShell. 5. Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to analyze complex technical issues and provide effective solutions. 6. Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to interact professionally with customers and internal teams. 7. AWS certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect, AWS Certified SysOps Administrator, 8. Experience with monitoring and logging tools such as CloudWatch, CloudTrail, and Splunk is preferred. 9. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment with a customer-centric mindset.

column2: SUT Hospital is looking for Asst Manager IT to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey       The Assistant Manager, IT, is responsible for providing leadership and support in the planning, implementation, and management of the organization's information technology systems     This role involves overseeing the day-to-day operations of the IT department, managing a team of IT professionals, and collaborating with other departments to ensure the effective use of technology in achieving business goals     Key Responsibilities:Team Leadership:Lead, mentor, and manage a team of IT professionals, fostering a positive and collaborative work environment     Conduct regular performance assessments, provide feedback, and support professional development     IT Infrastructure Management:Oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of the organization's IT infrastructure     Ensure the security, integrity, and availability of data and systems     Collaborate with vendors and external partners to optimize technology solutions     Network and Systems Administration:Manage and troubleshoot the organization's network infrastructure, including servers, routers, and switches     Implement and enforce IT policies and procedures to ensure system reliability and data security     User Support and Training:Provide technical support to end-users, addressing hardware and software issues promptly     Develop and deliver training programs to enhance the IT skills of employees     Project Management:Lead IT projects from initiation to completion, ensuring adherence to timelines and budgets     Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project requirements and objectives     Budget Management:Assist in the development of the IT budget, ensuring resources are allocated efficiently     Monitor and control expenditures to stay within budgetary constraints     Strategic Planning:Contribute to the development and implementation of the organization's IT strategy     Evaluate emerging technologies and make recommendations for adoption based on the organization's needs     Compliance and Risk Management:Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards in IT operations     Identify and mitigate IT-related risks through proactive measures and regular assessment
